loans.name: Sillah

texts.en: Sillah is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged 4, 5 and 10. He has two additional dependents who live with him. In 2001, he opened a spare-parts (auto and motor) business after losing a brother who was supporting the home. Sillah has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and is now requesting a new loan for Le 4,000,000 to buy engine oil. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 575,200. In the future, Sillah plans to move to a bigger shop and expand. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a spare-parts business

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Abu Bakarr. He is married and has five children, aged 3, 6, 8, 12 and 16. He has three additional dependents who live with him because they are a late brother's children.  

In 2001, Abu Bakarr established his used shoes business. The business was started separate from his wife's rice business to be able to maintain the home. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones). Abu Bakarr has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy four bales of used shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 462,560. In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to improve the sales of school shoes and educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used shoes.

loans.name: Al-Omniat Group

texts.en: This loan group is called Al-Omniat and has four members, all of them women. They are hardworking and live in Sana`a, Yemen. Mkia leads this group. She is 36 years old, married and has four children. She is a housewife who works hard to ensure that her children will have a good life. She has a house and would like to buy home appliances. She is requesting for a loan for 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator for her home. She hopes to improve her house and enroll her children in a private school.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb is 31 years old and lives in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three children (one daughter and two sons), all of whom attend school. To make a living, Chreb farms rice and plants sesame, earning approximately 17,000 KHR per day and, after offsetting her daily cost of living, saving around 8,000 KHR. A first-time borrower, Chreb is leading a group of six women who all are also first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They want to take out a loan for 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Chreb will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to apply in her rice field. In the hope of increasing her income and using her anticipated income to educate her children, Chreb will use her loan portion efficiently and wisely.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 37-year-old married man who has three children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He is a teacher in school and has requested a loan of 370,000 YER to pay for his home improvement expenses. He would also like to buy some furniture.

He is looking forward to improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements and furniture.

loans.name: Yi's Group

texts.en:
Yi, 63, is a villager from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is married and has four children. 

Rice farming is the main source of her family's income. She and her husband have been in this business for almost 33 years to make a living. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 8,000 per day and save about KHR 3,000 each day for future needs. Her main challenge for her business is the lack of working capital.

This is Yi's group of four with VisionFund. She has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already while the others have been with VisionFund from one to two cycles. The past loan from VisionFund have helped her support her business. After successful loan repayment, she is now leading her group to apply for another loan. 

She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy basic household necessities. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy basic household necessities.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Senghean's Group

texts.en:
Living in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Senghean is aged 29 years and married. He has two dependent daughters who are still small. He and his wife are rice farmers who have been in this business for five years and sometimes he works for others to gain additional income to better feed his family. The current business earns him about KHR 15,000 per day, and he manages to save about KHR 7,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Senghean's group, consisting of four members who live in the same area. He is leading his group to apply for a loan, and he will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. He hopes to increase his crop yields and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
A 32-year-old villager from Kampong Cham province's Ou Reang Ov district, Chheang is married with two children, one daughter and one son. She and her husband are hardworking farmers who farm rice and also plant sesame to gain more income. She has been in this business for about ten years, earning about KHR 10,000 per day, and she can save about KHR 5,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first microloan for Chheang's group of three who live in the same area. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for a loan, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her yields and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en: Chanry lives in a rural area of Moung Russey district, which is located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 22 years old, married and has two dependent daughters, both of whom attend school. Chanry earns her living by farming rice on a two-hectare plot of land and by planting corn on a three-hectare plot. She has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already, and used these loans to improve the living conditions of her family. In the hope of harvesting a good-quality crop so that she can boost her income even higher, Chanry is leading a loan group of two women who are applying for a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. For both of them, this will be their third loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Chanry will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to apply in her farmland. She will be very happy to see her expectations--increasing her crop yields and improving the living condition of her family--come true after receiving the loan portion and using it as she plans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke is in her forties and has three school-aged children. She was raised in a family that was persecuted by the regime, and she was 22 years old when things changed in Albania with the collapse of communism. Yet, for many of these people who were raised and lived under such circumstances, it became very difficult to integrate back into society. 

Pashke left her village and went to a different district, searching for a better life. There, six years back, she opened a variety store and has been operating it ever since. Her store is the only one in the village, and the profit is not bad, she claims.

Pashke wants now to buy a large amount of inventory items for her store and hopes that she will get some financial support from lenders. Her promise to them is that she will pay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of inventory for her variety store

loans.name: Taif Al-Amal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Taif Al-Amal and consists of five ladies. They are working in their businesses daily to increase their profit and offer good living conditions to their families. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. All of them have applied for a loan of 140,000 YER.

Amah is the leader of the group. She is 46 years old, a widowed woman who lives in Sana`a,Yemen. She is a tailor who makes ladies' clothes. She started her business in her house and is still working in her house. She has been in this business for 20 years. Since she is a professional in this field, she has attracted a lot of clients. She has applied for a loan of  50,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine as well as a fridge. She hopes to expand her business to open sewing store.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine as well as a fridge

loans.name: Buyan-Orshih

texts.en: Buyan-Orshih is 34 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. A year ago he married 24-year-old Uuriintuya who stays home with their son. Buyan-Orshih started a tire repair business of his own in 2010. He has two assistant workers. He has many customers and has improved his business's net profit. Buyan-Orshih is a hardworking and neat man. He says that welding is a much more profitable and sustainable business idea. He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to expand his business by selling tires and providing welding services for his customers.

loans.use: To expand his business by selling tires and providing welding for his customers

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en: Vy is 38 years old and lives in a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is the married mother of three children. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and have been in this business for about 15 years. To better support the family, they sometimes work for others for additional income. By working hard, they both can earn about KHR 15,000 a day and save about KHR 7,000 a day for the future. This is the first microloan for Vy's group, which has two members, each of whom would like to borrow KHR 500,000. She is going to use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow more rice and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Marlene Yesenia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate.

En este lugar vive la señorita Marlene,  tiene 34 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Estudia párvulo en una Universidad los días sabados y domingos.
  
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora pues además de estudiar trabaja de lunes a viernes en una guardería de la ciudad, también se dedica a elaborar manualidades,  adornos y sorpresas  en diversos motivos, productos que entrega y elabora a base de pedidos de sus clientes y de una organización del gobierno,  estos productos los elabora a base de fomix, telas, esponja y otros materiales con los cueles les da un  bonito acabado por lo cual sus obras se venden muy bien, ella lleva más de 6 años realizando esta labor con la cual ayuda a sus padres y a tres hermanos menores en sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar esponjas, pinturas, escarchas, fomix y otros materiales necesarios para elaborar sus productos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan a través de los créditos.
 
Su sueño es obtener su titulo de licenciada.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Virgen de Monserrate" meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees."

Señorita Marlene lives in this place. She is 34 years old. She is single and lives in the house of her parents. She studies preschool education at a university on Saturdays and Sundays.

She is a hard-working woman, since in addition to studying, she works from Monday to Friday in a city nursery school. In addition, she makes crafts, decorations, and party favors of different themes, products that she provides and makes based on orders from her customers and from a government organization. She makes these products from Fomix foam paper, fabric, sponges, and other materials which give her a nice finished product. For this reason, her work sells very well. She has been doing this for more than six years, and with it she has helped her parents and her three younger siblings with their schooling.

She is going to use this loan to buy sponges, paints, glitter, Fomix foam paper, and other materials needed to make her products. She is one of the founders of the communal bank and she likes the bank for the help that they offer through the loans.

Her dream is to obtain her bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to buy sponges, paints, glitter, Fomix foam paper, and other materials

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Aged 31 years, Chanthy resides in a rural area located in the Krokor district of Pursat province, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, she cultivates rice as her main business. To better feed the family members, she raises pigs in the backyard of her house. She has been a farmer for about 13 years. Her current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. With the income earned, she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is Chanthy's first loan with VisionFund. She is taking out a loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy pig feed and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to feed her pig to be fat and healthy, and also hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Phoeurn, 60 and a citizen from Battambang Province, is father of five children. He and his wife have struggled in order to raise his family by rice farming on three hectare of farmland. He has engaged in his business for 40 years.This is his first loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. He is now seeking 1,000USD in order to purchase a water pump, rice seed, and gasoline. He hopes that this purchase will provide a sufficient water supply for his rice business and give him back a high yield. By doing so, he can earn more income for his family's sake.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, rice seed, and gasoline

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia de 52 años de edad vive en Bolivia en la ciudad de Cochabamba, estudio hasta el nivel bachillerato no pudo culminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos familiares, tiene 4 hijos que dependen de ella, desde muchos años Cecilia se dedica a la venta de comida de servicios gastronómicos ya que ella prepara platos a pedido para eventos especiales, alcaldías y otros eventos mas, también se dedica a la venta  de abarrotes, Cecilia es humilde y muy trabajadora ya que ella hace todo para dar lo mejor a sus hijos no cuenta con el apoyo de su marido ya que le dejo abandonada con sus hijos ya que ella se hace cargo sola de todos sus hijo y ella hace todo por darles una vida mejor y pagar sus estudios de sus hijos. El presente crédito que solicita Cecilia es para la construcción de su vivienda, ya que quiere mejorar su estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Cecilia, age 52, lives in the city of Cochabamba in Bolivia.  She has a high school education, but she was not able to finish her studies due to her family’s lack of financial resources.  She has four dependent children.

Cecilia has had a food service business for many years.  She makes the dishes by order for special events, the municipal government, and more occasions.  She also sells groceries.

Cecilia is humble and very hard-working.  She does everything in order to give the best to her children.  She does not have support from her husband because he abandoned her and her children.  She alone takes care of all of her children.  She does everything in order to give them a better life and to pay for their education.

The current loan that Cecilia is requesting is to build her house because she wants to improve the family’s stability.

loans.use: to build her house.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: MARTHA TIENE 56 AÑOS VIVE EN LA ZONA DE ALTO SAN PEDRO DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, VIVE EN ALQUILER, VIVE SOLA, TIENE UN HIJO, EL CUAL ES INDEPENDIENTE, CUENTA CON LA VENTA DE VAJILLAS CON 6 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN SU ACTIVIDAD. REALIZA VIAJES A ORURO, DE DONDE SE PROVEE LA MERCADERÍA. COMERCIALIZA EN SU ZONA Y CUENTA CON CLIENTELA SEGURA, TAMBIÉN VIAJA A LOS YUNGAS DONDE DEJA MERCADERÍA A PEDIDO DE SUS CLIENTES. LA CLIENTE CON EL TRANSCURSO DEL TIEMPO AHORRÓ DINERO DE DONDE CON ESE PEQUEÑO AHORRO SE CAPITALIZÓ PARA LA VENTA DE VAJILLAS, ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA EDUCÓ A SU HIJO SOLA DESDE QUE NACIÓ CON EL SUSTENTO DE SU PROPIO TRABAJO, A LA FECHA AÚN SIGUE GENERANDO INGRESOS CON EL NEGOCIO QUE TIENE. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA EN VAJILLAS, DONDE REQUIERE DEL MISMO PARA INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA Y TENER UN POCO MÁS DE INGRESOS POR LAS FIESTAS DE FIN DE AÑO. EN CUANTO A SU EXPERIENCIA QUIERE MEJORAR SU NIVEL DE INGRESOS, CUENTA CON ACTITUD DE PAGO Y EMPRENDIMIENTO EN LA ADMINISTRACIÓN DE SUS INGRESOS Y DE SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Martha is 56 years old and lives in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  She rents and lives alone.  She has one son, who is an adult.  

She has worked selling dishes for six years.  She travels to Oruro where she obtains her merchandise.  She sells in her area and has a fixed customer base.  She also travels to Los Yungas where she drops off merchandise her customers have ordered.  Over time, she saved money and with her small savings, she started her business selling dishes.  She is a single mother and educated her son alone since he was born with money from her own work.  Currently she is still generating income from her business.  

Martha plans to use this loan to purchase dishes to increase her merchandise and have a little more income from the holidays at the end of the year.  As for her experience, she wants to improve her income.  She has a payment attitude and is enterprising in administering her income and her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the end of the year.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 40 years old and married, and has four children.  He lives in Aden, Yemen. 

Ali has been running a gas cylinder selling business for seven years.  He works hard to be able to make a good monthly profit.  

To help expand his business, Ali has requested a loan of 100,000 YER  from AMB. The loan will be used to buy more gas cylinders for resale, and will help him to generate greater profits and earn money for his business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a car to help him in his business.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders for resale.

loans.name: Al-Akrm Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs call themselves “Al-Akrm.” They are five members who know each other and live in Aden, Yemen.

Fatima is 55 years old. She is a married woman and has eight children who live in Aden, Yemen. She has been selling cosmetic materials, perfumes and incense. She loves her business.

She started her business by taking the first loan from AMB to buy cosmetic material, then selling to her area, and the result has been very favorable, Now, she took a second loan of 80,000 YER (Yemen rials) to buy cosmetic materials, perfumes and incense. This motivated her to commit to this group of enterprising women to acquire a loan that will allow her to expand the variety of products and increase merchandise she has on sale at present. She trusts that this investment will continue producing dividends and benefits that will lead to a better quality of life for her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials, perfumes and incense.

loans.name: Rose Henriette E.

texts.fr: Rose Henriette est âgée de 41ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés, l'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 16ans et 07ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des tissus et des plastiques depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement à la demande de sa clientèle, Rose Henriette a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rose Henriette is 41 years old and married. She is the mother of 3 children, who have been to school. The oldest and youngest are 16 and 7 years old, respectively.

Rose Henriette has specialized in the sale of fabric and plastic items for several years now. She procures her goods in one of the Benin markets. 

In order to increase her turnover and to respond favorably to customer requests, Rose Henriette sought and received funding through Finadev. This funding will allow her to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy one bale of fabric and 20 plastic items

loans.name: Beronica Palmira

texts.es: Beronica Palmira de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, pan, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores  ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Beronica es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar, dia a dia se esfuerza con constancia y amor al trabajo por sabe que así logrará el éxito que tanto desea, en el ultimo mes de venta aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, huevos, bebidas, jabones, etc. Beronica Palmira tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beronica Palmira, age 39, lives with her life companion and their children. She has a small store where she sells basic necessities such as grain, milk, eggs, bread, soap, and other items. Beronica has been in business for several years and has gained valuable experience that has been useful in obtaining more income. She sells from her home and already has many customers who prefer to do business with her because she offers quality products, affordable prices, and excellent service. Beronica is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and has many goals that she wants to accomplish. Every day she strives to work persistently and lovingly because she knows that that is what it takes to achieve the success she desires.

Demand increased during the last sales month, so she wants to take advantage of this trend by making a new investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy basic grains, snacks, instant products, eggs, beverages, soap, and other items. Beronica Palmira has good credit references who have impeccable reputations. They vouch for her ability to repay this debt and are confident that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, instant products, eggs, beverages, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 19 years, and married.  He doesn't have any children. He lives with a family of seven members, four of whom are employed.
Abbas owns a shop for tire maintenance. He established his business in 2011 and he has one employee. No competition exists in the surrounding area. He built a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.  He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a machine specialized for his business. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a 27 year-old married woman and a mother of two. She  is a very hard working lady. Her husband is involved in agriculture. It was very difficult for her to fulfill the needs of the family members because the income of her husband is not enough to meet them.  So they purchased two buffaloes for selling the milk in their community to earn more income.  Zainab looks after them very well and her husband assists her in selling it door-to-door. Now she wants to expand her business by purchasing one more buffalo. So she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 for purchasing a buffalo. It will help her to generate more income and hence, better support her family.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, 49, is a married mother of eight children. She has been engaged in selling various kinds of fruits in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Of her eight children, she still has four to take care of, and they are still in school. She has been in this fruit-selling business for several years. Her current occupation earns her approximately 40,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day, after meeting daily expenses.

Pov has received loans from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles already, and the other member of Pov's Group has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. Pov fully paid back her loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s burdens and improve their livelihood. Now she and her group member are applying for another loan, of 2,000,000 KHR. As group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more fruit to resell. She hopes that this new loan will enable her to grow her current business, earn a larger income, and make convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Lamia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Lamia, which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Mdiha is the leader of this group. She is 41 years old, married and has three children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife who exerts herself to raise up her children in a good life. She intends to buy home appliances.  She said she has small money which she collected herself, but it is not enough to buy her house needs. So she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine, fridge, etc. for her home. 

She hopes to build a big house and enroll her children in a private house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine, fridge, etc. for her home.

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Thom, 30, lives in a thatched-roof house in a rural village located in the Kror Lanh district. She is married with two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other is too young for school. She earns a living by growing rice. She has been doing this for ten years, and her husband is a paid construction worker in the local area. Her current business earns her about 10,000 KHR per day, of which she can save about 6,000 KHR for the future. 

This is the first microloan for Thom's group. Her group, which consists of herself and a neighbor, is applying for a loan of 200,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. With this loan, she hopes to grow healthier rice so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Residing in Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia, Savy is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. Some of her children are students while others are employed as rice farmers. To support her family, she has grown rice and raised pigs for more than 25 years, earning approximately 14,000 KHR per day and managing to save around 6,000 KHR after living costs. 

Recently, Savy's business has faced some challenges, such as unhealthy pigs and the lack of pig feed, leading her to request her first loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Thus, she is now requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. With a portion of this loan, Savy will buy feed for her pigs. She will spend the rest of the loan on bamboo ladders to support her husband’s business, which is making palm juice. After receiving the loan and using it in a smart manner, Savy strongly believes that her pigs will be healthier and fatter, and that she will be able to sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Kandal Stoeng district, Sophat is 38 years old and divorced. She has one dependent daughter who is still in school. To make a living, she has been cultivating rice for about 18 years and selling palm cake for 10 years. The current business earns her about 6 USD per day. She can save about 2 USD each day for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Sophat's group of four members who live in the same area. Sophat has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, while the others are clients in their first and second cycles with VisionFund. The first loan helped her increase her income and better support her daughter's education. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to support her daughter's education by paying for things such as schooling materials. She hopes to increase her business and earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland and pay for education expenses

loans.name: Simorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Simorn is aged 37 years and married with four children, two of whom are dependent on her. The source of her family's income is from rice farming on 1.5 hectare and cassava plantation on 1.5 hectare of farmland and she has been in this business with her husband for about fifteen years. With her hard work at the field, she manages to earn about KHR15,000 per day and can save about KHR3,000 each day for the future.

This is the first micro loan for Simorn's group of two who live in the same area. Simorn is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend to cover a fee to carry water into her rice field. This loan will enable her to grow her rice fruitfully and she hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, de los cuales solo una hija de 20 años vive con ella y su esposo. Ella se dedica a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 20 años, esta actividad  la realiza con el apoyo de una hermana a quien le paga $8.00 por día y le dá la alimentación. Argumenta que la razón por la que se dedicó a esto fue cuando su esposo quedó desempleado y desde entonces realiza esta actividad., su esposo le ayuda a repartir o entregar pedidos de las tortillas.

Los insumos los obtiene con comerciantes pequeños de la zona quienes hasta su casa le llevan la materia prima. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de material de construcción para reparar su vivienda y $800.00 serán invertido en los gastos del matrimonio de una hija.

Con la inversión busca, la seguridad de sus bienes y pertenencias del hogar, al tener en buenas condiciones su vivienda y la realización de uno de sus sueños el casamiento de una de sus hijas, a la que apoyaran con los gastos.

Entre sus proyectos esta construir en un terreno una vivienda para dejar a sus hijos con una vivienda para cada uno; seguir trabajando en el negocio y ver la realización profesional y familiar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, married, and has two children, of whom only her 20 year old daughter lives with her and her husband.  She has worked making and selling tortillas for 20 years.  She works with her sister, who she pays $8 a day and she provides food.  María began doing this work when her husband was unemployed and she has done it ever since then.  Her husband helps her to distribute and deliver orders of tortillas.  She obtains her ingredients from small vendors in her area who bring their wares to her home.  

She will use this loan to purchase construction materials to repair her home and invest $800 in her daughter's wedding expenses.  She is looking for security for her property and household belongings by having good conditions in her home.  The wedding of her daughter is the realization of one of her dreams.  

Among her projects is building a home on her land to leave each of her children with a home.  She wants to continue working at her business and see her children become professionals with families.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her home and to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Choeurt's Group

texts.en:
Choeurt, 48 years old, is a villager residing in a rural area of Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He is a single father of seven children, three (one daughter and two sons) of whom are under his responsibility and currently in school. To continually provide income for his beloved family, he plants corn, the business that he has been involved in for ten years, on six hectares of farmland. 

Choeurt is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The first loan that he requested has helped him cover the cost of labor and pay the fees for plowing his farmland. 

Choeurt’s group consists of three members. As a group representative, he is leading his group to take out a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR in total. With his requested loan portion, which is 1,000,000 KHR, he will support his farmland by buying supplies such as fertilizer, corn seeds, and pesticide. The other portion of the loan will be spent on covering the cost of labor. His only hope in the future is to have sufficient working capital in order to keep his business alive so that he is able to provide his family with a decent quality of live.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, corn seeds, and pesticide

loans.name: Proeurng

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng district, Proeurng, 56, is married with five children. To feed his big family, he has been growing rice with his wife for about twenty-nine years. He also runs a motor rickshaw (tuk tuk) to earn extra income. With his current business, he can earn about $16 per day and can save about $11 each day for his future needs. 

Proeurng has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already. He has successfully paid back his past loans, which helped him purchase a hand tractor and a decent motorbike. He is confident in his ability improve his family's quality of life with these loans from VisionFund. Now, he is taking out a loan of $800 to buy a water pump for his rice farming business. He will also use a portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm and pay other necessary household expenses. With this loan, he hopes to increase his current business and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Soheng

texts.en:
Soheng is a 41 year old married woman with two children. She and her family reside in a rural area of Kror Kor District located in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She farms rice and raises pigs in order to earn a decent living for the family. To make her family’s finances even more secure, this hardworking woman (Soheng) also has a business buying and selling rice. Each day, she is able to earn approximately 34,000 KHR and, after deducting her daily cost of living, saves around 14,000 KHR for future needs. 

Soheng is a first time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use this requested loan to buy fertilizer so that she is able to keep her farmland in good shape. Her only hope in the future is to see improvement in the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio es natural de la comunidad de Pairumani de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba está ubicado aproximadamente a 90 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba sobre la carretera antigua a Santa Cruz, actualmente es natural y vive en la dicha comunidad con sus dos hijos que depende de él y junto a su esposa, la vivienda donde vive es rustico con techo de teja con revoques de barro con piso de concreto, el señor es de una familia muy humilde. Su actividad económica es la agricultura que producen tubérculos y cereales en la zona produces diferentes productos tienen riego que son distribuidos de por represas. El presente crédito que está solicitando es para insumos agrícolas el cliente tiene el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos en los próximo año como también es cliente antiguo que cancela sin dificultad sus cuotas de los anteriores prestamos, asimismo está solicitando el tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Gregorio is from the Pairumani Alto community in the Tiraque province in the department of Cochabamba. It is located approximately 90 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba on the old road to Santa Cruz.  He currently lives in said community with his wife and their two dependent children.

The house where he lives is very basic with a tile roof, mud plastering, and a concrete floor.  He is from a very humble family.

His business activity is farming.  Tubers, grains, and different products are produced in the area, and the dams in the area provide the irrigation.  

The current loan that he is requesting is for agricultural supplies.  His objective is to improve his income in the coming year.  He has been a client for a long time, and he made his previous loan payments without difficulty.  He is requesting his third loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Hussin

texts.en: Hussin is 55 years old, married with seven children.  He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has had a house for 15 years. He was able to build his house from his salary at that time. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for his home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his home.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est une femme de 49 ans qui a deux (02) enfants âgés 24 et 20 ans. La commerçante a ouvert et gère un mini restaurant scolaire depuis 7 ans dans lequel elle vend des repas africains et des boissons gazeuses. Ce crédit va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de matière premières pour ces repas (riz, macabo, viande, spaghetti, ndolé...) et son stock de marchandises (jus, eau minérale...) afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice.  Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité, l'autre pour acheter une terrain et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et éducation)
texts.en:
Cécile is a 49-year-old woman who has 2 children aged 24 and 20 years old. She opened and has managed a small school canteen for 7 years in which she sells African meals and carbonated beverages. 

This loan will allow her to increase her stock of the basic ingredients for these meals (rice, taro root, meat, pasta, ndole [bitterleaf]...) and her stock of goods to sell (juice, mineral water...) in order to respond to customer requests and to increase her sales and profits.

She will use a portion of the profits to reinvest in her business, another to buy some land, and another to support the needs of her family (nutrition and education).

loans.use: to by goods (juice, mineral water) to resell

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La señora Filomena tiene 44 años está casada con el señor Benigno García, tienen 2 hijos pequeños, la mayor tiene 10 años y un  hijo recién nacido. Viven en la provincia de Punata, son una familia muy unida ya que los dos provienen de una familia de bajos recursos económicos, pero gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación a su trabajo lograron comprarse un lote de terreno donde construyeron una pequeña casa donde viven actualmente. La principal actividad de la señora Filomena es la producción de la leche cruda, para su posterior elaboración de Quesillo para su venta a las panaderas de la misma provincia y el esposo se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros. El destino del crédito es para la compra de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementará la producción de la leche y tendrá más ingresos. Entre sus sueños y mentas de la señora Filomena es terminar de construir su casa ya que falta la obra fina y que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Filomena, 44, is married to Benigno García and has two children, one 10 years old and the other a newborn. They live in Punata province as a very close family, since they come from low-income families. Thanks to their efforts and dedication to work, they managed to buy land to build the small house where they live now. 

Filomena mainly produces fresh milk for further processing in Quesillo so that it can be sold to bakeries in the province. She will use this loan to buy milk cows to increase her production and income. Among other dreams and ideas, Filomena wants to finish building her house and wants her children to pursue professional careers and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
La Señora. María es la presidenta del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, se encuentra realizando el sexto crédito en este grupo, vive por el sector de Racar en la ciudad de Cuenca, Racar es un lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente es trabajadora, se dedican en su mayor parte a la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, también laboran en la agricultura y cría de animales, algunos trabajan en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas. Aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. María tiene 48 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, una de sus hijas esta estudiando enfermería, su otra hija se encuentra en el colegio y su última hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad.  La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora y hace un mes a puesto un negocio de venta de comida y tiene un pequeño kiosco donde vende colas, dulces, bocadillos, etc. y por el momento le va bien ya que cada día tiene más clientela. En su casa se dedica  a la crianza de cerdos, pollos y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras las mismas que las vende en un mercado de la ciudad.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en su kiosco comprando gaseosas, bocadillos, confites y más productos para este negocio.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
María is the president of the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (Future for Wellbeing) communal bank and is taking out her sixth loan in this group.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Racar sector, a place where the beauty of nature can be enjoyed.  Its residents are hardworking and for the most part work manufacturing bricks and roof tiles.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  Some work in the city in various economic activities.  They still preserve their culture and traditions.

María is 48-years-old, separated from her husband but while married had five children.  Two of them are married and live independently, one of her daughters is studying nursing, another daughter is in secondary school and her youngest daughter attends a local elementary school.  The house she lives in is hers.

She is an enterprising woman who set up a food stand a month ago and has a small kiosk where she sells soft-drinks, candy, snacks, etc.  For the moment, she’s doing well because she has more customers every day.  At home she raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs and also works in agriculture growing vegetables that she sells in one of the city markets.

She will use her new loan to invest in her kiosk; she will buy soft-drinks, snacks, sweets and other products for the business.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village located in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Nat is a 29-year-old mother of four children.  All of the children are still in school. For the past ten years, she has been planting cassava and maize as the main source of her family's income. With her current business, she can earn about 33,000 KHR per day. A lack of working capital is her main challenge in conducting her business. 

This is the first loan for Nat with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now applying for a loan of 650,000 KHR, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her yield and sell her crops for a good price, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Doeurng

texts.en: Deoung, aged 45, is a villager living in a rural area of Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. He is a single father of seven children. Two (one daughter and one son) of whom are dependent on him. He makes his living through farming rice. He has been involved in this business for seven years. He is able to earn around 16,000KHR each day and, after offsetting his cost of living, saves approximately 6,000KHR. This is his first time requesting a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR. He will use this for purchasing fertilizer to support his farmland. This hard-working father, Deoung, hopes that his business will provide him with good quality crop yields so that he will be able to increase his income and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Sab's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of Bakan district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Sab is 39 years of age and married. She has three dependent children (one daughter and two sons), all of whom are students. To make a living, she is a rice farmer on a three-hectare farmland, earning around 15,000KHR per day. Due to the crop yields being destroyed by insects, Sab is leading a group of four members to apply for a loan in the amount of 4,000,000KHR in total. For all of them, this will be their first time requesting a loan via VisionFund(Kiva's partner). As a group representative, Sab will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her rice farm. Sab’s biggest hope is to be able to keep her beloved children in good schools so that they all will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds

loans.name: Villa De Suerte Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias que se dedican cada quien a sus actividades de negocio una de ellas es Janeth que anteriormente su negocio era vender frutas su esposo e hijo le ayudaban en el negocio inicio hace dos años, actualmente tiene una hermosa pulpería en su casa y uno de sus sueños es convertirla en una miscelánea bien surtida, este crédito lo invertirá en comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar, papel higiénico et. Gloria vende ropa usada y calzado, Sandra María tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group comprises three members engaging in different businesses. Two years ago, Janeth, who previously sold fruit with her husband and son, started a lovely grocery store in her home. One of her dreams is to make the store larger and offer more inventory. She will use this loan to buy items such as rice, beans, oil, bath soap, laundry soap, toilet paper, and more. 

Gloria sells used clothing and shoes; Sandra María has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, beans, oil, bath soap, laundry soap, and more.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 41, is married and resides in a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has seven children, five of whom are dependents and still in school. Sometimes, her dependent children work for others for a fee to help their mother in supporting the family. She is a hard-working rice farmer who has been in this business for 22 years. She also supplements her income by growing vegetables for sale. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day to feed her family members. She is wise in managing her earned income and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is Sophat's first loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She is taking out a loan of 2,800,000 KHR with VisionFund to buy a water pump for her farming business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business so that she earns a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Blanca Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es una socia alegre y activa del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy cálida, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Blanca tiene 47 años, es separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 27, 25 y 19 años de edad, sus tres hijos son casados y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Doña Blanca es comerciante hace 35 años, ella vende de una gran variedad de especias como: clavo de olor, anís estrellado, canela, etc. las mismas que vende recorriendo por toda la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. 

Se encuentra en el séptimo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de canela, anís estrellado, clavos de olor y otras especias para continuar con esta actividad. 

Su meta es agrandar su negocio y tener un local propio para vender estos productos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very cheerful, active member of the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (Future for Wellbeing) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Totoracocha sector.  This city has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999.  It’s architecture is a mixture of colonial and modern; its residents are very warmhearted and they preserve the culture and traditions of their peoples.

Blanca is 47-years-old, separated from her husband but while married had three children who are 27, 25 and 19 years of age.  Her three children are married and live independently.  she does not own a house; she a renter.  

Blanca has been a merchant for 35 years.  She sells a great variety of spices like clove, star anise, cinnamon, etc. from place to place throughout the city; she works Monday through Saturday with no fixed schedule.

She’s in her seventh loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy cinnamon, star anise, clove and other spices to continue with her activity.  Her goal is to enlarge the business and to have a locale of her own in which to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, star anise, cloves and other spices.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Mongkul Borey district, Vanna is 30 years old and widowed. She lives with two children, who are still in school. Vanna earns a living through farming rice and selling vegetables in the local area. Having been in these businesses for five years, she can make good profits to support her children. However, a lack of working capital for her vegetable-selling business is still her main challenge. 

This is the first loan for Vanna with VisionFund. To overcome the challenge, she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. She will use most of this loan to buy more vegetables to resell, and use a portion of it to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase the profits from her current businesses, so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell and buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Eak's Group

texts.en: A mother of two schoolchildren and four paid workers, Eak is 50 years old and a rural villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province,Cambodia. For her family's sake, she and her husband grow rice on their one hectare plot. Eak has been in this business for 30 years. Eak is the leader of a group of two and she is in her fourth cycle of loans while her fellow group member is in the twelfth loan cycle. After the most recent loan which has been completely paid back, she feel very satisfied and empowered. It has provided her a decent income for a proper daily food. Now, she and her additional group member are applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide for her crop, and use a portion of it to cover her children's education. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so she can continue to keep her standard of living better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Nestor Francisco

texts.es: Néstor  vive en la ciudad de Guayaquil, tiene 61 años de edad, está casado,  su esposa vende comida en la tardes, sus hijos no viven en su casa son independiente. Néstor es conductor de un taxi. El trabajaba antes vendiendo comida con su esposa, pero el siempre le ha gustado los carros  Néstor es muy aficionado por eso se compro un carro y ahora lo puso el carro como taxi, pues en la actualidad ese es su fuente de dinero para su casa . Su meta es tener una flota de taxis y tener su propia cooperativa de taxi .Con el préstamo quiere comprar: llantas, pintura para su carro, herramientas, etc.
texts.en: Néstor, 61, lives in the city of Guayaquil and is married. His wife sells prepared food in the afternoons. Their independent sons no longer live at home. Néstor drives a taxi, though previously he helped his wife sell food. He has always been a fanatic of cars. He purchased one to use as a taxi and provide household income. His goal is to have a fleet of taxis and his own cooperative. He will use the loan to buy tires and paint for his car, tools, and other items.

loans.use: to buy tires and paint for his car and tools.

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en: Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khun makes a living with her husband through rice farming in order to provide daily decent food for her only son. To earn extra income, her husband works for others for a fee. Involved in this business for 2 years, she is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day. Khun's past loan was her first loan. She has successfully paid back the loan, which has supported her rice business, on time. This has helped her sustain her family's living conditions. Now, she forms a group of four to seek the new loan. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to increase her yield and sell for a high price, so she can save some money to setup a new business for extra income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Lucia Ivonne

texts.es: Lucia vive en Duran está casada tiene 1 hija que estudia en un colegio  público del sector. Su esposo trabaja como  contador público.  Ella comenzó con una muy pequeña cantidad de mercaderia y ahora cuenta con un stand de ropa. Por lo tanto Lucia  quiere contratar a más empleados para su negocio. Su sueño es expandir su negocio y ofrecer trabajo a personas que no lo tienen. Su meta es ser una muy buena empresaria y abrir  sucursales de venta de ropa en todo el Ecuador.  Con el préstamo, ella va a comprar mercadería tales como:  pantalones, faldas y blusas, Abrigos, shorts etc.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in Duran. She is married and has one daughter that is studying in a state school. Her husband is a chartered accountant. She began with a small amount of merchandise and now she has a clothes shop. 

Lucia wants to take on more staff for her business. Her dream is to expand her business and offer jobs to people who do not have one. Her objective is to be a good business women and open branches all over Ecuador. With this loan Lucia is going to buy merchandise such as, trousers, skirts, tops, coats, shorts etc.

loans.use: trousers, skirts, tops, coats, shorts etc.

loans.name: Gisella Elizabeth

texts.es: Gisella vive en la Orquídeas sector Norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Ella  tiene 28 años de edad . Se encuentra actualmente soltera. Y tiene 2 hijos que asisten a estudiar a una escuela pública por el sector.   Gisella cuenta que todo comenzó cuando Ella trabajo en la peluquería de su hermano. Ella cuenta que ese negocio es hereditario porque su padre también tenía una peluquería. Pues Gisella en la actualidad decidió hacer su propia peluquería o salón de belleza. Con  la ayuda del Banco D-MIRO  ella desea que su negocio crezca  cada día más y así poder comprar herramientas para su salón de belleza. Con el préstamo Gisella quiere comprar: secadora, tintes, maquinas para cortar cabello, etc.
texts.en:
Gisella lives in the Orquídeas area in the northern part of the city of Guayaquil. She is 20 years old and currently single. She has two children who go to a public school in the area. 

Gisella says that everything started when she worked in her brother's hair salon. She says that that this line of work is a legacy, because her father also had a hair salon. Now Gisella has decided to set up her own hair and beauty salon. 

With the help of Banco D-Miro, she wishes her business to grow each day, and to be able to buy tools for her beauty salon. With the loan, Gisella wants to buy a hairdryer, hair coloring and hair-cutting tools, etc.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer, hair coloring, and hair-cutting tools.

loans.name: Choeurt's Group

texts.en: Choeurt, 59, is a mother of one child, and lives in Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She struggles to meet her daily needs with her two hectares of rice-growing farmland. This is the only business that she has had for ten years, and it enables her to earn about 16,700 KHR per day. Choeurt's Group consists of two female members; both of them are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Choeurt is seeking 800,000 KHR, and her co-member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Choeurt, the leader, is going to use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm. She greatly hopes that she will gain double income, so she can improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Tania Irene

texts.es: Tania tiene 36 años de edad, Ella entre risas comenta  que está soltera porque dice que nadie ha llenado sus expectativas. Tania  trabaja en una empresa pública, pero ella quiso independizarse y ahora está tomando el negocio de ventas de Bisuterías. Ella sale a trabajar a domicilio y los vende toda la mañana y tarde porque  en la noche ella esta estudiado en la universidad. Tania se está preparando mucho por lo que en el futuro ella quiere ser una empresaria y tener local de venta de bisuterías bien surtido. Con el préstamo Tania quiere comprar: joyas, anillos, relojes, etc.
texts.en:
Tania is 36 years old. Laughing, she says that she is single because no one has fulfilled her expectations. Tania works in a public enterprise, but also wanted to work independently, and now has a business selling costume jewelry. 

She goes door-to-door and sells all morning and afternoon, because at night she attends university. 

Tania is getting a great deal of training, as in the future she wants to be a business person and to have a well-supplied costume jewelry shop. With the loan, Tania wants to buy jewelry, rings, watches, etc.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, rings, watches, etc.

loans.name: Las Chicas De San Fernando Group

texts.es: Las Chicas de San Fernando es un grupo antiguo, sus integrantes han sido muy puntuales en día y hora con respecto a sus pagos durante los 7 ciclos que tienen con la empresa. La señora María Guadalupe es una mujer madura de 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 29, 27 y 15 años. Ella se dedica a la venta por catalogo; anteriormente ella ya tenia tiendita de abarrotes, pero por causas personales la tuvieron que quitar. Ahora ella desea volver a surtirla y el crédito la ayudara a cumplir su sueño de iniciar la venta de abarrotes de nuevo.
texts.en: Las Chicas de San Fernando is an established communal bank. Its members have made their payments on time for the seven loan cycles they have been in business. María Guadalupe, 54, is a mature, married woman with three children, ages 29, 27, and 15. She sells catalog merchandise. Previously, she had a grocery store that she had to close for personal reasons. Now she wants to restock it, and the loan will help her fulfill her dream to reopen the store.

loans.use: to buy stock for a grocery store.

loans.name: Marlene De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Marlene se encuentra realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, fue  imvitada por una vecina quien forma parte del grupo hace algún tiempo, vive por el sector de Racar en la ciudad de Cuenca, Racar es un lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente es trabajadora, se dedican en su mayor parte a la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, también laboran en la agricultura y cría de animales, algunos trabajan en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas. Aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Marlene tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 10 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Ella trabaja en una fábrica en donde elaboran jeans, esta actividad la ha aprendido trabajando, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Los fines de semana trabaja vendiendo cosméticos de varias marcas. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para agrandar la variedad de su mercadería. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marlene is taking out her first loan in the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (Future for Wellbeing) communal bank.  She was invited to join by a neighbor who has been a group member for some time.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Racar sector, a place where the beauty of nature can be enjoyed.  Its residents are very hardworking and for the most part work manufacturing bricks and roof tiles.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  Some have jobs in the city.  They still preserve the culture and traditions of their peoples.

Marlene is 32-years-old and the single mother of a 10-year-old son who is attending a local elementary school. She does not own a house so lives with her mother sharing household expenses.  She works in a factory where jeans are manufactured; she learned this activity by doing it.  She works from Monday through Friday from 8am until 5pm.  She works weekends selling various brands of cosmetics.

She will use her loan to buy cosmetics to increase the variety of her merchandise.  Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Por Fe Group

texts.es: Este grupo formado por cuatro socias solidarias de éxito una de ellas es Cruz María quien tiene un taller de costura que realiza trabajos en series y a la medida actividad que viene realizando desde hace 15 años, actualmente cuenta con cuatro trabajadores quienes están de lleno en el proceso productivo de los productos que hacen, tiene cinco años de estar trabajando con la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la  compra de materia prima como hilo, telas, elásticos etc. Isabel destaza cerdos, comercializa a los mercados parte de la carne el restante hace nacatamales los días fines de semana en su domicilio, Martha Isabel vende cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat, y ropa nueva, Ruth del Carmen vende ropa nueva y usada
texts.en:
This group comprises four members dedicated to success. For 15 years, Cruz María has had a commercial dressmaking shop. She now employs four people to help in the production. She has been working with the institution for five years and will use this loan to buy supplies such as fabric, elastic, thread, and more. 

Isabel slaughters hogs to sell in the markets; she uses some of the meat to prepare nacatamales in her house on the weekends. Martha Isabel sells cosmetics from Avon and Zermat and new clothing. Ruth del Carmen sells used and new clothing.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, elastic, thread, and more.

loans.name: Clotilde Flerida

texts.es: Clotilde vive en el Fortín zona norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos una de 16 años de edad y al otro de 14 años de edad los dos asisten a un colegio publico del sector. Ella viendo la necesidad de su hogar ya que hace 2 años atrás su  esposo se había quedo sin trabajo. Ella tomo la decisión de crear su propio negocio y fue así cuando comenzó  la venta de víveres en su casa.  Ahora en la actualidad a juntado la tienda y un bazar y papelería. Su meta es poder agrandar mas su negocio por lo ella se esfuerza trabajando día a día. Con el préstamo Clotilde va a comprar: arroz, cuadernos, aceite, láminas, plumas etc.
texts.en: Clotilde lives in El Fortín in the northern section of the city of Guayaquil. She is 47, married, and has two children, ages 16 and 14 who attend the local public high school. Two years ago, her husband lost his job, and she knows her family's needs. She decided to open her own business selling foodstuffs in her house. She has since added a bazaar and stationery selection. She works hard every day to meet her goal of growing the business. Clotilde will use the loan to buy rice, notebooks, oil, paper, pens, and so forth.

loans.use: to buy rice, notebooks, oil, paper, pens, and so forth.

loans.name: Huon's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural area in the Bakan district of Pursat Province, Cambodia, Houn is a 51- year-old widow. She has eight children, one of whom is dependent on her and currently in school. To support her family, she grows rice and sells groceries, earning approximately 12,000 KHR per day. 

Houn is a second-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan that she requested has helped her relieve her family’s burdens and improve her family's quality of life. Now she is in need of money to buy fertilizer to improve her farmland and increase her working capital. Therefore, she is leading a group of three female members to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. With the help of her portion of this loan, Houn believes that she will be able to boost her income even higher.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Santos Leonor

texts.es: Santos de 49 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17. 12 y 3 años de edad, quienes dependen por completo de ella, ya que santos no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie para sostener su hogar. Santos elabora pupusas de queso, revueltas, y de frijol con queso, las cuales elabora de forma improvisada sobre  la calle principal donde personas que se dirigen a su trabajo pasan comprando pupusas para su desayuno todos los días. Las pupusas son el plato típico más aceptado del país y cuenta con gran demanda. Santos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima por mayor, así mismo para comprar gas propano y un toldo para refugiarse del sol.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old and lives with her three children (ages 17, 12, and 3) who are completely dependent on her. She does not rely on help from anyone else in order to sustain her household.

Santos prepares “pupusas” filled with cheese, a mixture of meats and vegetables, or with beans and cheese. She prepares the food to order along the main street where people travel on their way to work, so many stop by to purchase “pupusas” for their breakfast each morning. Pupusas are a traditional dish that is widely accepted across the country, so there is great demand.

Santos is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies in bulk. She will also buy propane gas and a canopy so that she can protect herself from the sun.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, propane gas, and a canopy.

loans.name: Hurn

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Hurn, 32, lives with her husband and six children. She earns a living through cultivating rice. This is the family's only source of income. Having been in this business for more than ten years, she manages to earn about 21,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs. However, like many other villagers, Hurn lacks working capital. This is the main challenge for her family's business. 

This is the first loan for Hurn with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. To solve her lack of working capital, she will take out a loan of $500 with VisionFund. With this loan, she wants to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm, pay for labor and renovate her house. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business. This will allow Hurn to earn a larger income, improve her standard of living and send and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy está realizando el primer crédito en el banco comunal Futuro por un Bienestar, ha ingresado a este grupo por la invitación de su hermana quien es socia, vive por el sector de Racar en la ciudad de Cuenca, Racar es un lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente es trabajadora, se dedican en su mayor parte a la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, también laboran en la agricultura y cría de animales, algunos trabajan en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas. Aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Nancy tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar. 

Ella trabaja en el oficio que aprendió de sus padres que es la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ganado. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de arcilla para la elaboración de ladrillos. 

Su meta es crecer en su negocio de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Nancy’s taking out her first loan with the “Futuro por un Bienestar” (Future for Wellbeing) communal bank.  She joined the group invited by her sister who is a member.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Racar sector which is a place where the beauty of nature can be enjoyed.  Its residents are hardworking and for the most part manufacture bricks and roof tiles.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  Some have jobs in the city.  They still preserve their culture and traditions.

Nancy’s 37-years-old, single and living in her parents’ house with whom she shares household expenses.  She works in an occupation she learned from her parents: manufacturing bricks and roof tiles.  She also raises pigs and cattle.

She will use the new loan to buy clay to manufacture bricks.  Her goal is to grow in the brick manufacturing business.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Carmen Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión hace 2 años, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene un clima frió, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Carmen tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 10, 9, 7 y 5 años que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como empastador, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Ella trabaja a diario sin un horario fijo en la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, actividad que la desempeña hace 6 años, le gusta este trabajo porque le da tiempo para poder cuidar de su familia.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para incrementar su mercadería.

Su meta es llegar a ser una directora en la venta de estos productos.
texts.en:
Carmen has been a member of the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women of Vision) for two years.  She lives in the city of Cuenca’s Miraflores sector.  This city has a cold climate and has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999 thanks to its architectural beauty.  It has several places in which to enjoy nature.  Its residents are kind, gracious and still preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Carmen is 27-years-old, married and has had four children who are 10, 9, 7 and 5 years of age; they all attend the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a bookbinder.  She does not own a house; she rents.

She works every day with no set schedule selling various brands of cosmetics; she’s been doing this for six years and likes it because it gives her time to care for her family.  She will use her new loan to buy cosmetics to increase her stock of merchandise.  Her goal is to become a cosmetics sales supervisor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita tiene 47 años de edad,es soltera y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al ngeocio de venta de ropa y venta de zapatos,la socia vende pantalones,blusas,chompas y polos para mujeres y varones,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en una de las plazas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 25 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar.La socia solicita le credito para comprar zapatos,polos,chompas,polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita is 47 years old. She is single and has three children. She runs a business selling clothes and shoes. She sells trousers, tops, jumpers and polo shirts for women and men. She sells her merchandise on the street in one of the town's squares. Margarita works from 8am to 6pm. Her business has been up and running for 25 years and it is going well. Her dream is to have a market stall. She is asking for a loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, jumpers and tops. 

Margarita is happy to receive the loan and she promises to meet her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, jumpers and tops

loans.name: Nom's Group

texts.en:
Nom is 29 years old, married, and has two children.  She is one of the breadwinners for her family; they live in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She strives for a living via her rice cultivation on four hectares of farmland. Besides helping in the field, her husband helps her by earning additional income, working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the rice business, which she has been engaged in for seven years. For her, shortage of water is the main challenge for her business, and it lowers her income. 

Nom, in the group of three, is in her fourth loan cycle. She has successfully used her past loans in a wise manner, upgrading her living conditions and maintaining her business. Now, she is applying for 1,200,000 KHR, while the other two group members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR, each. Nom, who is the group's leader, will use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer, and gasoline to run water pumps for her rice field. She hopes to double her rice yield, and multiply her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: José  vive en el fortín zona norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil tiene 33 años de edad, está casado, tiene 4 hijos todos estudian en una escuela pública del sector. José heredo el negocio familiar pues sus padres tenían una tienda anteriormente pues ahora él se ha independizado junto a su esposo en el trabajo de venta de víveres.  El trabaja  todos  los  días de lunes a domingo de 6:00am hasta 22:00pm y su esposa lo ayuda con el negocio. Su meta  con la ayuda de Dios es ampliar su negocio y darle una mejor vida a su familia. Con el préstamo el comprar: carnes, víveres,  granos etc.
texts.en:
José lives in a settlement in the north side of Guayaquil city. He is 33 years old, married and has 4 children who are all studying in a state school. José inherited the family business. His parents had previously owned a shop but now he has set up on his own together with his wife selling basic foods. 

José works everyday from Monday to Sunday from 6am to 10pm and his wife helps him run the business. His objective is to expand his business, with God's help, and give his family a better quality of life. With this loan he will buy meat, convenience store goods and basic staple foods.

loans.use: to buy meat, convenience store goods and basic staple foods

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Marisol, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora y multifacética, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria pero tambien paralelamente vende prendas de vestir como pantalones chompas,  camisas ponchos de lluvia. Marisol en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar fibra plástica para elaborar ponchos de lluvia ya que la época se acerca, Marisol trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para pagarles el colegio a sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida y educación a su familia.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of Tremors II) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She’s a young, hardworking, multifaceted mother.  She’s still selling food from place to place but also sells clothes like pants, sweaters, shirts and rain ponchos.

On this occasion, Marisol is requesting the loan to buy plastic fiber to make rain ponchos because the season is approaching.  Marisol works a lot and sacrifices to pay for school for her two children who are school age and this is why she’s very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to provide better quality of life and education for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic fiber to make rain ponchos.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
