Soy is 37 years old, married, and lives in a rural village located in the Bakan district of Pursat province. She has four children, who are still in school. For the last eleven years, she and her husband have been cultivating rice to make a living. In addition to rice farming, she runs a grocery store in front of their house, while her husband is a solider doctor. With the current businesses, she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Soy with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR.  She will use part of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and part of it to buy more grocery items to resell. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current businesses, so as to earn a larger income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland, and groceries to resell.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive por el sector de Quinta Chica en la ciudad Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene un clima frió, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 28 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres y comparte los gastos del hogar, su padre se dedica a la construcción y su madre se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Doña María se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende artesanías elaboradas en yeso, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años y su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de artesanías para tener una más variedad.
 
Su meta es tener su propio taller para fabricar sus artesanías.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Mujeres con Visión" communal bank. She lives in the Quinta Chica area of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate, and thanks to its architectural beauty, a World Heritage Site since December 1999.  Its people are friendly, kind, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

María is 28 years old, and the single mother of a nine-year-old son who attends a local preschool. She does not have her own home, so she lives in her parents' home, and shares the household expenses. Her father works in construction and her mother does the household chores.
 
Maria has a small business buying and selling plaster crafts. She has been doing this work for four years, and sells her merchandise by going around the city. She works from Monday to Friday without fixed hours.

This is the first loan she has undertaken with the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy crafts in order to have more variety.
 
Her goal is to have her own workshop for making her crafts.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Sofía, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, Sofía en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, verduras, carnes,  etc.  para elaborar sus alimentos, Sofía trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para pagarles la educación a sus hijos que están en edad escolar, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor educación a su familia.
texts.en:
Sofía is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of Tremors II) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She’s a young, hardworking, devoted mother.  She’s still selling food from place to place.

On this occasion, Sofía is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables, meat, etc. to make her dishes.  Sofía works a lot and sacrifices to pay for school for her children who are school age and this is why she’s very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to provide better education for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es un contratista de fontaneria. El necesita un prestamo de un millon de colones (1.000.000), que junto con lo que ha logrado ahorrar durante varios años, lo usara para comprar un automovil para transportarse a su trabajo.
Para marcos esto significara poder disminuir su tiempo de viajar al trabajo, ademas de poder ir a lugares mas lejanos a realizar su trabajo, ya que actualmente no puede ir a lugares lejanos ya que tiene que transportar herramientas.
texts.en: Marcos is a plumbing contractor.  He needs a one-million colon loan which when added to what his savings of several years will be used to buy a car to get to and from work.  For Marcos, this will mean a significant reduction in the time it takes him to get to work and he will also be able to get to more distant locations to work since he’s currently unable to get too far because he has to transport his tools.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.ru: Шарафнисо проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Шарафнисо занимается шитьем. Она шьет национальные платья для продажи. В этой области она 15 лет. Шарафнисо берет кредит для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Sharafniso lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 50 years old, married and has three children.  Sharafniso is involved in sewing.  She makes national dresses for sale.  She has been in this field for 15 years.  Sharafniso is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthorn is 44 years old and a mother of seven children, two of whom are still in school. Her main source of farming income is from her four hectares of rice field.  She has been in the rice-growing business for several years and has earned about 15,000 KHR per day. 

In this group of three, Chanthorn is the leader. She and one of her co-members are second-cycle loan clients of VisionFund, while the remaining co-member is a first-time borrower. The past loan that Chanthorn has paid back helped her to improve her business and her standard of living gradually. Now, she and her group members are seeking a new loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Chanthorn, the group's leader, will use her portion of the loan primarily to buy fertilizer for her rice farm; she will use some portion of the loan to buy school supplies for her children's education. She hopes to earn more profit from her current business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Азамчон родился 1992 года. В 1998 году поступил в школу и в 2009 году успешно окончил. После окончания школы он поступил в Таджикский Технологический Государственный Университет по специальности технолог-пищевик. Данное время студент 3 курса. Он очень способный молодой человек. Азамчон  в свободное время читает класическую литературу. Родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в этом году. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте вместе поможем молодому специалисту окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en: Azamjon was born in 1992.  He started school in 1998 and successfully completed it in 2009.  After graduating from school, he was accepted to the Tajikistan State Technology University with a major of a food technologist.  Currently, he is a third-year student.  He is a very talented young man.  Azamjon reads classic literature in his free time.  His parents are unable to pay for his education this year.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his university education.  Azamjon awaits your kindness.  Let's help the young specialist together to graduate from the university and apply his knowledge in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Gulafruz

texts.ru: Гулафрузу 21 лет. Она не замужем и живет вместе с родителями. Гулафруз хочет стать успешной бизнес леди и с такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей скота. Ее родители будут помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. У них большой огород и Гулафруз планирует выращивать откорм для  скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulafruz is 21 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Gulafruz wants to become a successful businesswoman and, with this goal in mind, has completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  She wants to start a business of buying and selling livestock.  Her parents will help her with running the business.  They have a large garden, and Gulafruz plans to grow livestock feed there.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to buy livestock in order to start her business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to start her business

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Manuel tiene la edad de 45 años es casado y tiene un hijo, el se dedica al transporte publico empleo en el cual lo ejerce desde hace mas de 11 años, en lo cual su esposa le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia unida ya que ella siempre se ha dedicado al hogar, el cuenta con su casa propia, por lo cual esta solicitando a kiva la ayuda para brindarle mantenimiento a su transporte para que sus clientes tengan una mayor comodidad y así su transporte funcionara con una mejor calidad.
texts.en: Juan Manuel, 45, is married and has a son.  He works providing public transportation, a job he’s had for 11 years.  His wife helps him keep the family together since she’s always been dedicated to their home.  He owns his house.  He’s requesting help from KIVA to provide service for his vehicle so that his customers will be more comfortable and his transportation service will be of better quality.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Antonia Soraya

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia se encuentra realizando el segundo crédito en el banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene un clima frió, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Antonia tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 20, 16, 14, 10 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de apenas 3 meses de de nacido, dos de sus hijos trabajan, ayudan en los quehaceres del hogar y estudian, uno estudia en el colegio y otro en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Antonia es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos y llego a la ciudad de Cuenca hace 13 años, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de comida hace 4 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, en sus tiempos libres trabaja vendiendo cosméticos de la marca Yanbal.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es mejorar su negocio y así entregarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonia is undertaking her second loan with the "Mujeres con Visión" communal bank. She lives in the Totoracocha area of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate, and thanks to its architectural beauty, a World Heritage Site since December 1999. It has several places for enjoying nature, and its people are friendly, kind, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Antonia is 41 years old, married, and has five children ages 20, 16, 14, 10, and her youngest child who is barely 3 months old. Two of her children work, help with the household chores and study. One goes to school, and another goes to a local preschool. Her husband works as a employee in a private company. They do not have their own home, so they rent.

Antonia is from the province of De Los Rios and came to the city of Cuenca 13 years ago. She has had a business selling food for four years, and works Monday to Saturdays from 8:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon. In her free time she works selling Yanbal brand cosmetics.

She is going to use her new loan to purchase groceries for continuing with her business.

Her goal is to improve her business and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dhakriat Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dhakriat and consists of seven ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB, to buy things they need for their businesses.

Khlod is a group member, who is 26 years old and a married mother who has one child. She lives in Aden, Yemen. For the past one year, she has been selling clothes, as a street vendor. She says this business allows her to generate income to cover the household expenses. She says that she is doing well, and that her sales are profitable. Khlod is requesting a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB, in order to buy more merchandise such as dresses, blouses, and shirts for inventory, so that she can have products to offer to her customers and improve her earnings. 

Her goals are to have her own shop where she can sell her merchandise, and to have the necessary capital to sell electrician materials.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as dresses, blouses, and shirts for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Amly Group

texts.en:
This group is called Amly and consists of three ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 180,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Ymnat is 37 years old and lives with her five children in Sana`a, Yemen. She has been selling basic products like clothes, perfumes and incense, among other things. She has had the business for many years and has many customers who come to her because it is the best-stocked place in the neighborhood.  

She needs to buy materials for business but has no capital, so is requesting a loan from AMB  to allow her to buy clothes, perfumes and incense, among other things. She hopes to expand her business to get more profit.

loans.use: to allow her to buy clothes, perfumes and incense, among other things .

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Mercedes, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida en su restaurante, Mercedes en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, menestras, verduras, carnes,  etc.  para elaborar sus alimentos, Mercedes trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para hacer crecer su actividad, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio.
texts.en: Mercedes is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of the Tremors II) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She’s a hardworking, self-sacrificing mother who continues selling food in her restaurant.  On this occasion, Mercedes is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc. to make her meals.  Mercedes works very much and sacrifices to make her business grow and this is why she’s grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Мутабар является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Мутабар  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей   скота. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Life hardships make us focus our efforts and put to use all existing resources. Mutabar is exactly one such person, trying to improve her living conditions and bolster the family budget. She is married and bringing up three children. Her husband earns a small salary.  His salary is insufficient to provide for family needs. Mutabar decided to help her husband provide for the family’s well-being. With this goal, she has completed a course “Reach for success”, organized by the Business Women’s Association, and earned a certificate. Now she is able to launch her own business and become successful in this domain. She would like to launch a business buying and reselling livestock. She plans to use the resulting income to ensure good education and nutritious food products for her children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 TJS in order to buy livestock for her new business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for launching her new business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 50-year-old, married man, and he has seven children.  He lives in Sana`a,Yemen.  He has been employed in Electricity association for many years. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 YER to buy household furniture.

loans.use: to buy household furniture.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Aged 20 years, Sreypov is married and living in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has one son who is still small. 

For the last several years, she has been farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of the family's income, while her husband is a carver to help support the family. With the current business, she can earn about US $6 and manages to save about US $4 each day for future needs. 

This is the second loan for Sreypov with VisionFund. She completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her better support her business. After the loan, she felt empowered and confident to make a better living, and now she is applying for a loan of US $650 with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more rice so as to earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Lida Hortencia

texts.es:
La Señora. Lida se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive por el sector de la 9 de Octubre en la ciudad Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene un clima frió, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Lida tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un niño de 5 años de edad. Su esposo labora en un taller de estucos (cielos rasos), no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Ella trabaja arduamente de lunes a viernes como empleada domestica y no tiene horario fijo de trabajo.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de juguetes para iniciar con este negocio ya que se acerca la temporada de navidad.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lida is undertaking her second loan with the "Mujeres con Visión" communal bank. She lives in the 9 de Octubre area of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate, and thanks to its architectural beauty, a World Heritage Site since December 1999. It has several places for enjoying nature, and its people are friendly, kind, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Lida is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a five-year-old child. Her husband works at a stucco shop, installing ceilings. They do not have their own house, so they rent.

She works hard Monday to Friday as a domestic, and does not have fixed hours of work.
 
She is going to use her new loan to buy toys in order to start this business, since the Christmas season is approaching.
 
Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy toys to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Julieta

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Jenny, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora y multifacética, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria y de prendas de vestir, según sea la temporada, Jenny en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como pantalones, casacas, zapatos y ponchos para lluvia, para capitalizar su actividad y prepararse para la próxima campaña navideña que esta muy cerca.
Jenny trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para pagarles el colegio a sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida y educación a su familia.
texts.en:
Jenny belongs to the Communal Bank, "Señor de los Temblores II", of the city of Cusco - Peru. The member is a young mother who is hardworking and versatile.  She continues to sell food door to door and clothing, depending on the season. 

This time Jenny is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, jackets, shoes and rain ponchos to capitalize on her activity and prepare for the upcoming holiday season.

Jenny works hard and sacrifices to pay for school for her two children who are of school age.  Therefore she is very grateful to Kiva for allowing a better quality of life and education for her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, jackets, shoes and rain ponchos.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Celia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa vendiendo golosinas de forma ambulatoria. Celia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como galletas, dulces, chocolates gaseosas etc. para capitalizar su comercio.
Celia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecerse y continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo brindarles una mejor educación a sus 3 hijos, 1 de los cuales es estudiante de un Instituto superior tecnológico .
texts.en: Celia’s a member of the “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of the Tremors II) communal bank in Cusco, Peru.  She continues selling snacks from place to place.  On this occasion, Celia needs the loan to buy merchandise like cookies, candy, chocolates, soft-drinks, etc. to capitalize her business.  Celia’s very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to strengthen and continue with her economic activity and by means of this work provide her three children, one of which is attending a superior technological institute, with a good education.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, chocolates, soft-drinks,etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Bolivia-Cochabamba en Provincia de Quillacollo-Colcapirhua en la Zona de Esquilan chico, estudio hasta el nivel bachillerato ya que no pudo culminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, tiene un pequeño hijo, Ana María se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, lo cual le vende el producto a su tía que es rescatista, tiene como experiencia mas de 2 años en su actividad económica, desde tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta para el ordeño y el acopio de forraje, Ana María es una persona humilde y muy trabajadora se dedica todo el día a la alimentación de su ganado ya que no cuenta con ayuda de nadie en la cría de ganado lechero. El presente crédito que solicita es para la compra de ganado en producción, para mejorar sus ingresos familiares y poder mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Ana María, 20, lives in the city of Bolivia-Cochabamba in Quillacollo-Colcapirhua Province in the Esquilan Chico Zone.  She studied up to high school but was unable to complete her education for lack of economic resources.  She has a small son.

Ana María works in raw milk production.  She sells the milk to her aunt who collects it.  She has more than two years’ experience in her economic activity.  She rises very early in the morning to milk and gather forage.  Ana María is a humble, very hardworking woman who spends all day feeding her cattle since she has no one to help her care for her dairy cattle.  The present loan requested is to buy dairy cows to improve family income and production.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Eng, 48, is married and resides in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has six children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through cultivating rice, while her husband is a house builder. Having been in the rice farming business for more than twenty-five years, Eng can earn about 25,000 KHR per day from her current business. She manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day, after living expenses, for future needs. 

This is a group loan for Eng's Group, which consists of three members who live in the same area.  Eng has been a member of VisionFund for two loan cycles already, while the other group members are first- and fifth-cycle clients. Eng's past loans from VisionFund, which she successfully repaid, have helped her to better support her business. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan from VisionFund, Eng (who is the leader) will use her portion of this loan as follows: she will use part of the money to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and part to buy cement for her husband's business. 

With this loan, Eng hopes to increase her current business, and also hopes to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and cement for her husband's house-building business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La solicitante lucia   solo curso  hasta primaria  es casada en la comunidad colchani y tiene hijos de edad de escolares ,ella tiene su casa y terrenos en la misma comunidad de colchani  que esta en Patacamaya con lo que tiene parcela de terreno a sembrar papa, zanahoria haba y otros productos que  así fue mejorando su  producción y  vende  en la Ciudad de La Paz y en el misma localidad de Patacamaya .lo que paso con ella fue que en un viaje que realizo para ir a vender sus productos junto a su niña le paso que se enfermo y no podían dar con el origen ni la razón de la enfermedad , el esposo tuvo que vender algunos de sus ganados y productos para curar la enfermedad de la esposa y   como no tienen muchos recursos económicos , por el cual el crédito es para la compra de ganado mejorado y así le pueda rendir mas leche para comercializar la producción y así  obtener  mejores ganancias para poder sobre salir adelante junto a su familia ya que paso momentos muy desagradables al pensar que tenia que dejar a los hijos huérfanos.
texts.en:
Borrower Lucía only completed elementary school.  She’s married and lives in the community of Colchani.  She has school age children.  Her house and her fields are in the same community of Colchani which is in Patacamaya.  She grows potatoes, carrots, lima beans and other products and production has been improving.  She sells in the city of La Paz and in Patacamaya.

What happened to her was that during a trip she made to sell her products with her little girl, she became ill and they couldn’t determine either the origin or the cause of her illness.  Her husband had to sell some of the cattle and products to cure his wife’s illness and because they have limited economic resources the loan is to buy improved cattle so that more milk will be produced to sell thus earning higher profits to get ahead with the family having gone through very difficult times thinking she might leave her children orphaned.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Fausta Teofila

texts.es: La Sra. Fausta Teofila esta casada con el Sr. Manuel de Jesús  ella comenta ya que no tiene hijos que dependan de ellos, esta solicitando el quinto crédito en nuestra institución lo requiere para comprar mercancía y así poder dar un mejor servicio a los clientes , su negocio se denomina como miscelánea Mary, su giro es enfocado a una tienda de abarrotes desde hace mas de 10 años que esta en existencia su miscelánea, ella comenta estar satisfecha con nuestra institución porque sus pagos los realiza por mes
texts.en:
Fausta Teofila is married to Manuel de Jesús. She says they do not have dependent children. 

She is applying for her fifth loan with the institution. She needs it to buy merchandise, so that she can better serve her customers. 

Her business is called "Miscelánea Mary." Her life has revolved around her grocery store, for the more than 10 years that her business has been in existence. 

She says that she is satisfied with the institution, because she makes her payments monthly.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Norma, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven  muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la industria de la imprenta realizando todo tipo de trabajos en general, Norma en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar materia como papelería y suministros de imprenta, para la próxima campaña de almanaques o calendarios, Norma trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para hacer crecer su imprenta, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the Communal Bank, "Señor de los Temblores II", of the city of Cusco - Peru. She is a very hardworking young woman who remains dedicated to the printing industry doing all kinds of work.  

This time, Norma is requesting a loan to buy materials such as stationery and printing supplies to make next year's almanacs or calendars.  Norma works hard and makes sacrifices to grow her printing business so she is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to strengthen her trade.

loans.use: buy materials such as stationery and printing supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Rosa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con su actividad y principal ingreso económico familiar que es el servicio de taxi. Rosa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos como llantas a su herramienta de trabajo.
Rosa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo brindarles una mejor vida y  educación a sus 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales están en edad escolar.
texts.en: Rosa is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of the Tremors II) communal bank in Cusco, Peru.  She continues her activity and main source of family income: taxi service.  On this occasion, Rosa needs the loan to buy spare parts like tires for her work tool.  Rosa’s very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to continue with her economic activity and by means of it provide her four children, two of whom are school age, with a better life and education.

loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Al-Nasr Group

texts.en:
This group, which is called Al-Nasr, consists of five women. They are taking out a loan of 250,000 YER.

Dhira is a 30-year-old married woman and has four children, who are still in school. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a housewife. She has applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She would like to expand her house by building a second floor in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Petra

texts.es: La Sra. Petra de 42 años esta casada y con 2 hijos ambos trabajando por mas 12 años en maquiladora y viven en casa de interés social ala cual  le han ido realizando mejoras año por año y en esta ocasión necesitan apoyo de la institución para terminar el techo de madera en el portal, poner piso de concreto y pintar la vivienda.
texts.en: Petra, 42, is married and has two children.  They both have been working for more than 12 years in an assembly plant and they live in government subsidized housing that she’s been making improvements to year to year.  On this occasion they need support from the institution to finish the entryway’s wood roof, to lay a concrete floor and to paint the house.

loans.use: to lay a concrete floor, finish the wood roof in the entranceway and paint the house.

loans.name: Up Rising Group

texts.en:
Sia is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sia was born in Nimikoro, Koidu city in Eastern Sierra Leone 42 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary school respectively. Sia sells sugar, milk, butter, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 26 years now.

With the help of this loan, Sia and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Sia will use her share of the loan (800,000 Leones) to buy the above mentioned goods in large quantity to add to her shop. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer, Edward, posing with his clients.)

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, butter, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc. in large quantity to add to her shop.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is 31 years old, married, and has two dependent children who are still small. She lives in a rural village located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She earns a living by cultivating rice and raising chickens.  Rice and chickens are the main source of the family's income, while Sophy's husband is a paid worker. She has been in the farming business for ten years already.  She can earn about 29,000 KHR per day to make a living, and can save about 19,000 KHR each day for the future. 

This is a group loan for Sophy's group of three members, who live in the same area. All of them have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already. Her past loans, which Sophy completely repaid, helped her to better support her business. After successful repayment, she felt empowered and confident that she could make a better living for her family. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Sophy will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy net to surround her chickens. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and earn more income, to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy net to surround her chickens.

loans.name: Ayeseh

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Ayeseh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Ayeseh is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Karak, Jordan, who has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for home improvements she would like to do, including maintenance of the home and buying some households products. In the future she wants to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Manal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Manal is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Karak, Jordan, who has two family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for home improvements she wants to do, including maintenance of the kitchen and the rooms. In the future she hopes to add other rooms to expand her home and to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Sonia Narcisa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de cinco años de edad, el mismo que estudia en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo es obrero en el Municipio de Manta.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida, tiene una pequeña Carreta en la cual vende hamburguesas, hot dog, roscas, colas, aguas, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días por las tardes, lleva más de cinco años con su negocio el cual lo empezó con el primer crédito que obtuvo del banco comunal.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sodas, aguas, pan y otros víveres para  la preparación de los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Los Tres Ángeles” (The Three Angels) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Sonia, 46, lives here.  She’s married and has a five-year-old son who attends a local school.  Her husband’s a laborer in the city of Manta.

She is a very good housewife who in order to help with household expenses works making and selling fast-food and snacks.  She has a small food cart where she sells hamburgers, hot-dogs, cake, soft-drinks and water, among others.  She works every day in the afternoon.  She’s been in business more than five years and she started it with the very first loan she got from the communal bank.

She will use this loan to buy soft-drinks, water, bread and other foodstuffs to make her food.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  Her dream is to continue moving forward and to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, water, bread and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Sinat is 28 years old and married, and has two dependent children who are too young for school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for eight years, while her husband is a palm juice maker. Together, they can earn about 10,000 KHR per day to feed their family members, and can save about 4,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Sinat's group of two members, who live in the same area. Sinat has been a member of VisionFund for two loan cycles already, while the other group member has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles. Sinat completely paid back her prior loans to VisionFund. After the successfully-repaid loans, she felt empowered and confident that she could make a better living. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Sinat (who is the leader) will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her business and make more income, to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Maha prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Maha is a 51-year-old married woman who has 11 family members from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to buy blankets to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She would like to increase her products; she wants to buy accessories and cosmetic products to also sell with blankets. 

She hopes in the future to expand her project by selling her products to the market shops to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy blankets to resell.

loans.name: Francisca Aurora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos y un nieto de 6 años de edad el cual estudia en escuela y es como su hijo. Su esposo es discapacitado y no trabaja.

Para ganar el sustento diario y al ver que su esposo no puede trabajar hace mas de 8 años con los ahorros que tenia instalo un pequeño bar en el cual vende gaseosas, golosinas, aguas y otros bocadillos, trabaja todos los días ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa, a pesar de que su negocio no es muy grande esto le da para salir adelante y  gracias a los créditos que ha recibido ha podido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar gaseosas, aguas, papas fritas y varias golosinas más. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado.
 
Su sueño es que su nieto sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The “Los Tres Ángeles” (The Three Angels) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Francisca, 55, lives here.  She’s married and has six children, all adults.  One of her sons and a six-year-old grandson who attends school and is like a son to her live with her.  Her husband is disabled and does not work.

To earn daily sustenance and seeing that her husband has been unable to work for more than 8 years, she used her savings to open a small snack bar where she sells soft-drinks, sweets, water and other snacks.  She works every day because the business is home-based and despite it not being a very big business it does produce enough for her to get ahead and thanks to the loans she’s gotten she’s been able to move forward.

She will use this loan to buy soft-drinks, fried potatoes and several other snacks.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the help it’s always given her.  Her dream is that her grandson becomes a good professional.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, water, fried potatoes and several snacks.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Serafina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con su actividad económica familiar que es el servicio de planchado y pintura para vehículos motorizados en su taller mecánico. Serafina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar material como resinas acrílicas, pintura, soldadura entre otros para la producción de su taller.
Serafina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo brindarles una mejor vida y  educación a sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
The borrower is Serafina. She belongs to the communal bank  “Señor de los Temblores II” in the city of  Cusco – Perú. She continues with her own auto body painting and repair business in her mechanics workshop. Serafina is asking for a loan to buy materials such as resins, acrylics, paints and a welder amongst other things for her workshop. 

Serafina is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to continue with her business so that she can provide her 4 children with a better life and education.

loans.use: to buy materials such as resins, acrylics, paints and a welder.

loans.name: Narcisa Marisol

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 23, 13 y 11 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. El marido es cerrajero.
 
Doña Narcisa realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual tiene un taller de cerrajería, en el cual realiza muchos trabajos como puertas, ventanas, estructuras, etc. trabajos que realiza dentro y fuera de su taller, él trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ayuda de un operario a quien le paga un sueldo mensual, lleva más de 20 años con su taller y nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar hierro, soldaduras, pinturas entre otras materiales necesarios en su labor. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudar a sus marido.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Tres Ángeles" ["The Three Angels"] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are well-known on the national and international levels. This is the place where the famous "Panama" hats are made from toquilla fiber.

This is the home of Narcisa, who is 45 years old and has a common-law husband with whom she has three children, aged 23, 13 and 11. The children are studying at the university, secondary school and primary school. All of her children still live with her. Her husband is a metalsmith. 
 
Narcisa is taking out the loan to help her husband, who has a metal shop where he carries out many types of work such as doors, windows, structures, etc. He does this work both inside and outside his workshop. He works from Monday through Saturday, with the help of an operator whom he pays a monthly salary. He has run his workshop for more than 20 years, and he has never lacked for work. 

This loan will be used to buy iron, soldering materials, and paint, among other supplies that are necessary for his work. Narcisa has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and she likes it because in this way she can help her husband. 
 
Her dream is to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy iron, solder, paint and other supplies.

loans.name: Bassama I Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Bassma I” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 600,000 Leones for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Memuna is the featured leader of this group. The 37-year-old is married to a trader, and they have 4 children. Memuna has been a businesswoman for seven years. She sells market-food – rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in bulk, to add to her current ones.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward, posing with the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy market-food – rice, palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Roukiyatou

texts.fr: Agée de 40ans, Roukiyatou est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 10ans et 1mois. Elle vend des tissus et des sacs depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement afin de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier à Finadev. Cet appui lui permettra de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: At forty years of age, Roukiyatou is married and the mother of three children, two of whom attend school.  The oldest one is ten and the youngest is one month.  She has been selling fabric and handbags for several years, and she gets her supplies at one of the markets in Bénin.  In the hope of increasing her stocks in order to meet the demand of her customers, she has requested and gotten financial help from Finadev.  This help will permit her to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy two bolts of fabric and twelve handbags of differing quality.

loans.name: Martha Ideria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es artesano, el elabora sombreros de paja toquilla.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, ella sale a recorrer tres días de la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 20  años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo cual ya tiene mucha clientela que siempre le compran.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, "Los Tres Ángeles (Three Angels)", meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich culture and its pre colonial craftsmanship that is recognized nationally and internationally. It is the location of the famous Panama hats.

This is where Martha lives, she is 53 years old, married and has three children. They are all grown and independent adults. Her husband is a craftsman who makes straw hats​​.

Martha intended to gain something on your own and with that be able to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses. She sells all kinds of clothes door to door and also sells from her home where her customers come when they need a garment or new merchandise.  Martha goes out to sell three days a week, leaving her customers with credit and then collecting every fortnight. She goes to Guayaquil to purchase merchandise whenever she needs it. She has been in this business for more than 20 years so she already has a strong customer base

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. Martha has been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it for the help they always give and the credit to get by.
 
Her dream is to have a local shop.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 11, 10, 8 y 2 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Mercedes con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos,  siempre aprovecha las mañanas para salir a vender ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y está muy agradecida ya que así gana algo por el bien de su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sabanas y edredones. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Los Tres Ángeles meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and the artisan crafts, known for at a national and international level. This is where the famous straw hats come from.

Mercedes, 26, lives here. She is married and has four children, ages 11, 10, 8, and 2. The three oldest are in school. Her husband is a builder.

Mercedes sells all kinds of clothing, sheets, and quilts, with the idea of earning some money herself and with it, advancing her household. She sells by going from door to door. She also sells in her home, where her best-known customers come. She takes advantage of the mornings to go out and sell, because that is when her children are in school. She sells to her customers on credit and receives a payment every 15 days. Every time she needs merchandise, she goes to Guayaquil to buy it. She started her business with the first loan that she got from the bank, and she is very grateful, as she is able to earn something for the good of her family.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, like: pants, blouses, shirts, sheets, and quilts. She has been part of the Communal Bank from the beginning, and she likes it because she started her business thanks to the first loan. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and be professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, sheets, and quilts.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: Roman de 37 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador y responsable, vive junto a su esposa desde hace 7 años en el mismo lugar y desde hace 6 años que posee su propia carpintería, en donde se dedica a elaborar sillas, mesas, estantes, sillones, módulos y otros más. Él trabaja por pedidos y es muy responsable con las fechas de entrega por lo que tiene muy buenas referencias por parte de las personas. Román solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar madera en mayores cantidades, así mismo pegamento, serruchos nuevos y otras herramientas más para realizar este trabajo. El mayor deseo de Román es poder contar con una vida mejor junto a su esposa por lo que solicita dicho préstamo con el cual mejorará sus servicios y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Roman, age 37, is a hardworking and responsible gentleman. He and his wife have lived in the same place for seven years. Six years ago, Roman established his own carpentry shop where he produces chairs, tables, shelves, armchairs, modular pieces, and other items. He works according to orders and is very responsible in meeting his delivery dates. For this reason, people have given him very good references.

Roman is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy wood in large quantities. He will also purchase glue, new handsaws, and other tools that he needs for his work. His greatest wish is to have a better life along with his wife. By requesting this loan, he will be able to improve his services and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, handsaws, and other tools.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en: Sana'a is a 47-year-old married woman who has 6 family members. She is from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy accessories to resell to her friends and neighbors in her area. She hopes in the future to increase and expand her products.

loans.use: to buy accessories to resell

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Dalia prefers that her photo not be on the Internet.  Thus, the above photo is of her mother. 

Dalia is an 18 year old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy new electronic appliances and some household items. 

In the future, she hopes to create a good environment for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Raida

texts.en: Raida is a 31-year-old married woman who has 3 family members. She is from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy a new furniture and to repaint her home. She hopes in the future to create a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La clienta es una persona muy trabajadora mencionan sus vecinos, actualmente se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con cultivos de naranja y yuca, ella se  levanta a muy tempranas horas por la mañana para trabajar en sus cultivos para así poder tener un sustento en la mesa, los cultivos le alcanzan para poder sobrevivir y tener una vida moderada, ella vive en concubinato no mas de 12 meses su pareja se cuenta con una peluquería en la Localidad de Ivirgarzama, su pareja le ayuda con el alquiler del cuarto donde viven, actualmente no cuentan con hijos por el hecho de que no tiene las comodidades para poder formar una familia, la clienta con anterioridad trabajaba vendiendo DVD para su hermana en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, ella conoce bien el mercado y la actividad, es por eso que ella solicita un crédito en nuestra institución para así poder abrir su propia tienda de DVD y poder generar y tener un mejor ingreso económico y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is a very hard-working person, say her neighbors. Currently she farms, and grows oranges and yuca. She gets up at a very early hour of the morning to work on her crops so that she can put food on the table. The crops are enough for her to be able to survive and have a moderate livelihood.

She has been in a common-law-relationship for the last 12 months. Her partner has a hair salon in the town of Ivirgarzama, and her partner is helping her with the rent on the room where they live. At present, they do not have children due to the fact that they do not have the necessary comforts to be able to start a family. 

The client previously worked selling DVDs for her sister in the town of Ivirgarzama. She knows the market and the work well, and that is why she is applying for a loan from the institution so that she can open her own DVD store. This will enable her to create and have a better income, and this way be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy DVDs for setting up her video store.

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en: Marriam is a 40-year-old married woman who has 5 family members from Nao'or, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy a new furniture and some other households items. In the future, she wants to do home maintenance.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Faraj

texts.en:
Faraj is a 36 year old married man who has six family members from Jarash Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for his home improvements.  He would like to do maintenance on the home and repaint the home. 

In the future, he hopes to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his home impovements.

loans.name: Ragad

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Ragad prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Therefore, the above photo is of her son. 

Ragad is a 39-year-old married woman who has 3 family members. She is from Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for home improvements. She wants to buy new furniture for her home as well as some other households items. In the future, she hopes to do home maintenance and to buy a new computer.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Samar prefers that her photo not be on the Internet.  Thus, the above photo is of her son. 

Samar is a 36 year old married woman, who has six family members from Nao'or Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in her area.  She wants to expand her project by increasing her products. 

She hopes in the future to open a shop to develop her project, and also to help her husband financially.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Itedal

texts.en:
Itedal is a 45-year-old married woman who has five family members. She is from Madaba, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to pay for materials for making cheeses to sell in the same area. She wants to expand her project. 

In the future, she hopes to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making cheeses.

loans.name: Vicenta Eduvije

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 3 años y una linda bebe de 9 meses de nacida. El marido es plomero.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que él en ocasiones no tiene trabajo, se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, bisutería y varias cosas más. Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende  la bisutería.
	
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y bisutería. Lleva cinco  ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Los Tres Ángeles community bank meets every other week in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned crafts, such as its famous straw hats. This is where Ms. Vicenta lives. She is 34 years-old and has two 3 year-old children with her partner and a beautiful baby of 9 months. Her husband is a plumber. 

She's a homemaker, but she sells clothing, costume jewelry, and a variety of other items from a catalog to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, as there are times when he has no work. She works three days a week two or three hours a day, making her sales on credit and collecting once a week. She's been engaged in this for two years and it's going very well for her. Most of her sales are in costume jewelry. This loan is to buy clothing and costume jewelry. She's completed five loan cycles with the community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy for her to make. Her dream is to continue advancing.

loans.use: to buy clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Kholik

texts.ru: Холик продолжает свою деятельность. Он хочет заняться торговлей веников. Также он намерен заняться оптовой реализацией сладостей (халвы). Для этого ему необходимо получить кредит для приобретения веников и покупки халвы.
texts.en: Kholik is continuing his line of work, however, he also wants to start selling brooms and large quantities of halva. In order to realize this idea, he's asking for a loan to purchase some brooms and halva.

loans.use: to purchase brooms and halva.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak is a young mother of two school age kids who also studies in the local school in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is 27 years old and a farmer. She grows rice and cassava for her business. This business serves as her core income generator. She uses the profits for her daily survival. For the six years that she has been working in this business, she has earned about 18,000 KHR per day. 

This five member group is a first-cycle loan client, Vannak is the leader. She is seeking 600,000 KHR; one of her co-members is also applying for 1,000,000 KHR; the other three members are requesting for 800,000 KHR each. Vannak is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop. She hopes that this purchase will create good production and profit, so she can be better-off and raise her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena, es una joven de 21 años de edad es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque posee una venta de ropa para dama caballero y niños, lleba ya cinco años de dedicarse a esta actividad ya que es un negocio que le gusta mucho, agradece a Fape y kiva la ayuda que le han brindado ya que gracias a los crédito que le han brindado se ha superado en los negocio y a logrado surtir mas su negocio, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa en bariedad en tamaños y estilos, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado ya que de esta forma ella se seguira superando.
texts.en: Maria Elena, a young woman of 21 years of age, is from San Martin Jilotepeque. She works selling clothing for men, women, and children, and has been doing so for five years. She enjoys her work very much, and she is grateful to Fape and Kiva for the assistance they have provided as the loans authorized on her behalf have allowed her to get ahead in business and better stock her shop. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase clothing in a variety of sizes and styles, and she hopes the finances she has sought will help her to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items in a variety of sizes and styles.

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
Un is 65 years old and has seven children. Rice farming is the only business that she has had for 40 years in order to support the rest of her family with the help of her husband. This business earns her about 42,600 KHR per day. In the group of three, she and one other of her fellow group members are fifth-time borrowers while the remaining one is a second-time borrower with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. 

After the success of her past loans which have empowered her to improve her living conditions as well as her business, Un has paid back the loans entirely with success. For this new loan for her group, the total amount of the loan request is 2,100,000 KHR. Un's loan portion in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR will be used for buying five sacks of fertilizer and ingredients for making Khmer Noodle for resale as extra income. She greatly hopes that she can make double income from her businesses so that she can add it up with her saving in order to buy a decent motorbike for use in her business as well as for commuting.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer and ingredients for making Khmer Noodle

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Neda'a

texts.en:
Neda'a is a 20-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy accessories to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area, to improve her living standard. In the future she hopes to open a project. 

Since Neda'a is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy accessories to resell

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province (Cambodia), Khon is a cassava-growing farmer using her one hectare of farmland in order to provide decent food for all of her four school children. She has engaged in this business for 10 years and is able to earn about 16,700 KHR per day. However, her main challenge is the low price of cassava which seriously affects her daily income. 

Khon has not been with VisionFund before. Now, she has formed a group with other two members, the second-cycle loan clients, to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that this purchase will minimal the loss due to pests and boost productivity. She believes that she will receive a larger yield, so she can keep a good pace of her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
An original citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Reth is a local farmer and also mother of six children. Four of her children still depend on her as some are still in school and some are too young for school. Reth has been engaged in this business for 10 years. 

Her previous loan was the original loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the loan. After that successful loan, she feels empowered to sustain a standard of living for her family. Now, she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizer for her rice with her loan portion. She hopes to increase her income and get higher profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice.

loans.name: Sengheab's Group

texts.en:
Aged 41 and a citizen of Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham Province, Sengheab is married and also one of the breadwinners in her family consisting of five children. Two out of her children are still in school and still mainly need her support. To overcome the family hardship, she and her husband grow paddy on their two and half hectares of farmland, which they have been doing for 20 years and are able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day. 

This is the original loan for Sengheab and her other two members; it is a group composed of three members and Seangheab is the leader. The entire requested loan amount is 2,000,000 KHR, of which 500,000 KHR is the portion of Sengheab. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to boost its output and get back high income in order to sustain her household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 43-year-old divorced female from Al Bayader in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. Souad is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Lubna prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Lubna is a 37-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Kholoud prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Kholoud is a 36-year-old married female from Baqa'a in Jordan. she has 2 children and requested a 1,100 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothing. in the future, Kholoud is planning to expand her project by retailing in women's, men's, and children's clothing. Kholoud is looking forward to opening her own shop and building a home for her family.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothing

loans.name: Alexandra Cecilia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Las Palmitas.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 19 años de edad, es casada y está embarazada de su primer hijo. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, ella sale a recorrer tres días de la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Manta cada vez que necesita. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace   tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son tener su bebe y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city well known for its abundance of traditional items such as the straw hats known throughout the country and abroad, there is a bimonthly meeting of the members of the Las Palmitas Communal Bank.

This is where Alexandra lives. She is 19 years old, she is married, and she is pregnant with her first child. Her husband is an artisan.

Deciding to earn money on her own in order to get ahead and to help her husband with expenses at home, she started working selling all styles of clothing. She makes sales going door to door and she also makes sales from her own home, where customers come when they need a new garment or when she has new merchandise. She makes her rounds three days per week, she allows her customers to purchase on credit, and she collects payments every two weeks. She buys her merchandise in nearby Manta when needed. She has been running this business for two years and things have gone well for her. 

This loan will used to purchase more inventory, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for three lending cycles and she is grateful for the assistance that the loans provide her. She hopes to have her baby and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina de 46 años es casada, es una mujer muy emprendedora la cual ha trabajado por mas de 11 años para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, solicita de nuestro apoyo para construir en planta alta ya que siempre ha pensado en dejarla un buen patrimonio a su hijo, por lo cual solicita ayuda de la institución kiva sus pagos se harían puntual cada mes ya que se le facilita mas.
texts.en:
Christina is 46 years old, married, and is a very enterprising woman who has worked for more than 11 years to help her husband with the family's expenses. 

She is applying for help to build the upper floor of her home, as she has always thought about leaving a good legacy to her son. So she is applying for help from Kiva. Her payments would be made on time each month, as it makes it easier.

loans.use: To build the upper floor of her house.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Marisol, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, Marisol en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite etc. para capitalizar su tienda, La socia Marisol trabaja hace algunos años en esta su actividad, la cual le permite llevar el sustento a su familia y educar a sus hijos, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio.
texts.en:
Member Marisol belongs to the "Senor of the Earthquakes II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is the young mother of a family and is very hard-working. Marisol continues to dedicate her time to selling products of primary necessity in her grocery store. On this occasion, Marisol is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc., to restock her store. 

Member Marisol has worked for some years in this activity, which allows her to sustain her family and educate her children. And for this she is very grateful to Kiva for permiting her to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Abeer prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband, in her place.

Abeer is a 30-year-old married woman, from Jarash in Jordan. She has four children.  Abeer requested a 700 JOD loan to use in retailing clothes and home appliances.

loans.use: to do business in retailing clothes and home appliances.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Haya prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother.

Haya is an 18-year-old, single woman, from Jarash in Jordan. She requested a 900 JOD loan, to use for retailing in clothes business. Because Haya is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothes.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en: Sana'a is a 22-year-old, married woman, who has two family members, from Jarash in Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to repaint her home. She hopes to improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 37-year-old, married woman from Jarash in Jordan. She requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvements and painting expenses. Eman would like to buy some furniture, also.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more food stock, finish building her house and cover rent for the restaurant.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en: Shireen is a 28-year-old, married woman who has two family members, from Jarash in Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance of the home, and to buy some household items. She hopes to improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her home, and some household items.

loans.name: Keji Felex

texts.en:
Keji is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10.  All of them go to school.

Keji runs a restaurant and has been in business for 5 years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3000 SDG to purchase items such as beer and soda.  Keji’s restaurant is her only source of income. In 5 years, Keji would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Keji says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items such as beer, soda, and water for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ohoud
