Мухаррамчон очень рада что с помощью таких организаций люди могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Muharramjon is 57 years old and is married with two children.  She works at the city health center as a family doctor.  She has been a client of MDO Arvand since December 2011.  The first time she took out a loan was for her children's education.  According to Muharramjon, she is very pleased that it is possible to take out a loan to help realize one's plans.  Since she is educated and works in a professional capacity, Muharramjon has always dreamed of being able to give her children an education so they would not have difficulty with work.  She is asking for another loan to pay for her children's education.  Muharramjon is very glad that with the help of these organizations, people can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to pay for her children's studies

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз женщина с прекрасной душой. Ей 37 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 9 лет она занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Ее дети учатся в университете и в школе. Ее старший сын окончил среднюю школу в этом году и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Он очень способный молодой человек и свободное время увлекается спортом. Дилафруз запрашивает займ для оплаты обучения сына в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a woman with a beautiful soul.  She is 37 years old and is married with four children at home.  For more than nine years, she has been working in cattle breeding and growing crops.  Her children are in school and university.  Her eldest son finished high school this year and has been accepted at Tajik State University.  He is a very capable young man and in his free time he plays sports.  Dilafruz is asking for a loan to she can pay for her son's university education.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Nilufarkhon

texts.ru: Нилуфархону 22 года. Она очень трудолюбивая и мотивированная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Нилуфархон шьет красивые женские платья и поэтому она хочет реализовать свое ремесло в сфере бизнеса. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nilufarkhon is 22 years old and she is a very hard-working and motivated young woman.  She is married and has one child at home.  Nulufarkhon sews beautiful women's dresses and she wants to bring her craft into the business sphere.  With this goal in mind, she attended the "Bring It On" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is capable of starting her own business and becoming successful in that area.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni to buy a sewing machine to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to start her new business

loans.name: Alifmo

texts.ru: Алифмо очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Дом, где живет  Алифмо и ее семья  в плохом состоянии и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Ей 38 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Детям 18, 15, 13, 9, 3 и 2 года. Они учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но ее доход и доход мужа не достаточно для этого. Она должна заменить окна и двери, так как зимой они не держат теплоту дома внутри, а в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная. Из-за не удобства дома, у детей всегда насморк зимой. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов и окон для ремонта дома. Алифмо и ее дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Alfimo is a very good and hard-working woman.  The home in which she lives with her family is in a poor condition and urgently needs repairs.  Alfimo is 38 years old and is married with six children at home.  Her children are aged 18, 15, 13, 9, 3 and 2.  They attend school and are always asking their parents to fix their house, but the income of Alfimo and her husband does not allow for this.  She needs to replace the windows and doors, as they are not able to keep the house warm during the winters, which can get very cold in Tajikistan.  Because of the discomfort of their home, the children always have colds in the winter.  Alfimo is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy building materials and windows to repair her home.  Alfimo and her children will wait until kind creditors help them solve the problems of their home.

loans.use: To buy building materials like wood, cement and windows for repairing her house

loans.name: Ugulsapar

texts.ru: У нее трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Она -Угулсапар из Таджикистана. Ей 37 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более  10 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход она продает на рынке. Так как у нее высококачественный урожай, так и ее товары имеют большой спрос. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и Угулсапар одна обеспечивает семью и сама справляется с бизнесом. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами она хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого она должна получить больше урожая. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Доход, который она будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: She faces difficult living conditions and a small salary, but her heart is kind and her temper is good.  She is Ugulsapar from Tajikistan.  She is 37 years old and is married with four children at home.  For more than 10 years, she has been involved in raising crops like potatoes, wheat, carrots, etc.  She sells her crops in the market.  Because she has good quality produce, her goods are in high demand.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation and Ugulsapar takes care of the family and runs the business herself.  With the goal of providing for her family's needs, she wants to increase her business, so she will need higher crop yields.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.  Ugulsapar will use the income from her increased business to pay for her children's education and to improve their living conditions.  She needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Fatimah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Fatimah is a 45-year-old married woman from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. In the future, Fatimah is planning to buy some electrical devices and to build an additional room.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan who has 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for university tuition for her daughter. She hopes that her children will continue their education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition university for her daughter

loans.name: Lara

texts.en: Lara is a 31-year-old widow from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1100 JOD to buy various products, such as clothes, accessories and cosmetics to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area. She would like to increase her products. In the future, she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy various products to resell

loans.name: Chicas De Hoy Group

texts.es: Francisca es integrante del grupo Chicas de hoy, es una mujer madura y sobresaliente de 42 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza y tiene un club de nutrición. Lleva con su club de nutrición 2 años y decidió a comenzar con el negocio para poder ayudar a su madre que estaba muy enferma y gracias a estos productos pudo mejorar su salud y acaba de empezar con la venta de productos de limpieza (1 mes). Con el crédito invertirá en mas producto y comprara mesas y sillas para su club. A Francisca le gustaría mucho terminar de pagar todas las deudas de su negocio y mejorarlo para poder tener mas clientes. Ella piensa que su grupo es muy puntual con los pagos y siempre tratan de aprender mejores cosas.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the group "Chicas de Hoy."  She is a mature woman at the exuberant age of 42.  She is single, she sells cleaning products, and she has a nutrition club.  She has had the nutrition club for 2 years and she decided to begin it so that she could help her mother, who was very sick at the time.  Thanks to these nutrition products, her mother was able to improve her health.  Francisca also began selling cleaning supplies about a month ago. 

With this loan she will buy more products and be able to serve more customers.  She believes that her group is very punctual with payments and they always try to learn new things.

loans.use: to purchase more nutritional products, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Ravy's Group

texts.en: Ravy is a mother of three children. The rest of her family is living in a rural area of the Sangke district of the Battambang province. To overcome her family's hardship, she grows rice and sells fish. Her main challenge is flooding, which lowers her crop production. Ravy's group consists of two female members. She and her fellow group member are in their second loan cycle. The past loans, which she has paid back, has provided for better living conditions for her family. For this new loan, she is seeking 700,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 900,000 KHR. As group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes that there will be enough rainfall in order to support her yield so that she can gain a larger output and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna, a 25-year-old mother of one son, is a rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Her main source of income is from selling sweets, and her husband works at a construction site for extra income. She has been in this business for 5 years. Vanna has taken a microloan with VisionFund for four cycles and has paid them back with success. With the past loans, she can afford decent daily food. Now, she feels confident that she can sustain her living conditions in a standard condition. Now, she is in a group of four female members, and she is the leader. As a group leader, she will use her portion for ingredients for making sweets, such as sugar, fruit, ice, etc. She hopes to double the income from her business and to maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Micaela Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS,el banco pertenece al distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Micaela tiene 53 años de edad,03 hijos y es separada,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lenceria,ropa de baño,medias,fajas entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un local por el centro de la ciudad ,ella trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 09:00am hasta las 08:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de medias al por mayor y para algunos gastos personales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Micaela is a member of the community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

Micaela is 53 years old, she has 3 children, and she is separated.  She fills her daily activities with the sale of undergarments, swim suits, hosiery, girdles, and other items like these.  She has worked in this business many years and it has gone well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business every day.  She has a store in the center of the city and she works from Monday to Sunday from 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM.  She is a responsible and hard-working woman, and because of this, she has helped her family get ahead.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy undergarments for sale, and also for personal expenses.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy undergarments for sale, and also to be used for personal expenses.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret as a 57-year-old mother of five kids, who sells groceries to support her family. She has engaged in this business for 10 years. To continue with the good progress of her business, she formed a group of two members; she is an eight-time borrower and her co-member is a five-time borrower. She used her earlier loans with success to maintain her family's livelihood and business. They are each applying for the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR. As a group leader, Ret will use her loan to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to increase the income from her current business and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Sareuk's Group

texts.en:
Sareuk, 41 and a mother of three schoolchildren, strives for a living through rice farming while her husband works at a construction site. She has engaged in this business for 10 years. 

This is her fourth cycle loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has improved her living conditions from her past loan, which she has completely paid back. 

Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR and her co-member is seeking 800,000 KHR. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to increase her income so she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn is 40 years old and a mother of three children. The rest of her family is from Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province. She and her husband's main source of income is from working as the paid workers. 

This is the fifth-cycle loan for Phorn's group, which consists of three members with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. The past loans, which she has paid back, have provided her decent food for her children. As the leader, she will use her loan to fix her house. She hopes this loan will help her to fix her house on time, so she does not need to worry during the rainy season.

loans.use: To fix her house before the rainy season.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: Due to financial constraints, Romana aimed to improve her business to generate sufficient income and help her husband to finance the education of their children. She is now 39 years old and is blessed with six children. She and her husband aim to strengthen their sources of income so that they can continue to send their children to school and give them a bright future. In this regard, Romana plans to buy and sell more agricultural supplies and rice. She is asking for additional capital of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, fertilizer, rice and insecticide for resale. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to improve her business, and she hopes that she will become successful in managing her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer, rice and insecticide for sale

loans.name: Sakhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sakhoeurn, age 42, is a mother of four children from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province. She strives to make a living through working for others for a fee. Engaged in this business for five years, she makes 27,500 KHR. 

This is her fifth-cycle loan with Kiva's partner. In the group of two, Sakhoeurn is the leader. She has upgraded her living conditions gradually from her past loans, which she has completely paid back. Now, she and he co-member are applying for 1,400,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR. Sakhoeurn is going to use her portion to fix her house. She hopes to fix her house on time for her children's sake.

loans.use: To fix her house.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, a father of four schoolchildren, makes a living through buying recycled products for resale. To earn extra income, his wife raises chickens. Having been with this business for five years, he is able to make 42,800 KHR per day and he is able to save about 6,000 KHR per day. 

Sophal's group consists of three members. Two are fourth-time borrowers and one is the first-time borrower. 

Sophal has managed to overcome his family's difficulty from the past loan that he has paid back completely. Now, he and one of his co-members are applying for 1,400,000 KHR each while the remaining member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. 

As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy recycled items for resale and also to buy chicken feed. He hopes to make more income from his current business so he can maintain his living.

loans.use: To buy recycled items for resale.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 56 years old, married, and has four children. 

One of her primary sources of income is a hog-raising business. She has been doing this for almost seven years. 

Angelita wants to improve her piglets, so she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 to buy feed and vaccine. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to maintain the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine.

loans.name: Farooq

texts.en:
Ms Farooq is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has had a business of selling milk for three years. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She has a good client list. She is making enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is employed in a small general store but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenses of the family members. 

Farooq is liable for providing her children with good quality food, education and clothing. She has gradually improved her business, but now she needs a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy another cow. In this way she will be able to cope with the increasing demand of her customers. She wants to utilize part of the income on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en: Selesitina is a 47-year-old married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing a taro plantation to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy more supplies, such as chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, picks and weed spray. She has been a member of SPBD for 2010 years. Selesitina will spend her profits to improve and maintain the business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers, shovels, picks, weed spray

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a 45-year-old divorced woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, 3 daughters and 2 sons. One of her sons is a salesman while the other one runs his own service station.  Since 2007, Azra herself has been running a clothing shop, which is a very successful business. She is interested in growing her business by purchasing new materials, like ladies' suits, bedsheets, shirts, etc. for the shop. 

As a member of a 9-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the profit amount she is interested in opening a new shop. She dreams of her children's better future. She wants to live a good and simple life with her family. Salam and many thanks from her to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. Note: In the picture Azra holding a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for her clothing shop.

loans.name: Nouria's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hagl and consists of 3 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 170,000 YER.

Asma is a housewife and a very hard-working woman. She is a 31-year-old married woman and has three children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

She has a house. She needs a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials.

She wants to keep working very hard to be able to help her family and complete the building of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Gladis, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de jora que son granos de maíz procesado y que representa  el insumo principal para la preparación de la chicha de Jora, pero además de esta actividad, ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en donde realiza trabajos de corte y tratamientos de cabello y  de belleza. Gladis en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar jora, para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y tambien comprará algunos productos de belleza como tintes para cabello. Gladis está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio el cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Gladis belongs to the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” of the district of Andahuaylillas of the province of Quispicanchis of Cusco, Perú.  She is a young mother of a family and is very hard-working.  She makes a living selling “jora” which is processed grains of corn that represent the main ingredient in the preparation of “chicha de Jora” (a traditional drink).  In addition to this activity, she also has a small beauty salon where she performs hair cuts and hair and beauty treatments. 
 
On this occasion, Gladis is requesting the loan to buy jora in order to meet the demand of her customers and also to buy some beauty products such as hair dyes.  Gladis is very grateful to Kiva for permitting her to strengthen her business which allows her to bring sustenance to her home.

loans.use: to buy "jora" (processed corn) and beauty products like hair dyes.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is an industrious and responsible husband and father to his two children. His eldest child currently seeks a job, while the youngest is still an infant. His greatest dream in life is to have a stable source of income so he can educate his youngest child. He is married to a business woman.

Jerry would like to take out for a loan of PHP 20,000, allowing him to buy hog feed and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to obtain his goal in business and in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Lakhman's Group

texts.en:
Lakhman is a hardworking 48-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, daughter, and 2 sons in Punjab, Pakistan. One of her sons is an auto mechanic while the other one is jobless and searching for a job. Since 2008, her husband has been running his own general store. He works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business so that he can increase his net income. 

To help with that, Lakhman, as a member of 10-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will help her husband to purchase a variety of products like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, crockery, etc. for the general store. Stocking these goods will help satisfy the needs of his clients more professionally and increase his savings for his children's future. Lakhman and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. She dreams of better and successful future for her children. 

Note: In the picture, Lakhman is holding a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 30 years old, married, and has three infant-age children. They are raising their family in a rural community, planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. While she takes care of her kids, Editha runs a small variety store in their village to generate additional income. They aimed to improve their standard of living so that they can educate their children and give them a better life. She plans to improve her variety store to increase her income. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional loan of P20,000 to buy grocery items, frozen foods, vegetables and rice for resale. She mentioned that this loan will help her to make an improvement in the business. She hopes that someday they will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, frozen foods, vegetables and rice for resale.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Ms Safina is a 37-year-old active, married woman. She has been effectively operating a business of embroidery at her home for the last 5 years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members. She makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a small general store and one of her sons works in a repairing shop. However, their income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

Safina is a loving mother of six children.  She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a stock of threads and packs of pearls and sequins in different colors to meet up with the increasing demand for her embroidery designs. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family, and she intends to spend a part of her earnings on her daughters' education.

loans.use: To buy a stock of threads and packs of pearls and sequins in different colors to meet up with the increasing demand for her embroidery designs.

loans.name: Harris

texts.en:
Raising hogs is the business of Harris. He is a young and single person. He is the second child in his family. Before, he just helped his parents in running their livestock business, but since he is the right age, he now manages their livestock business, which has been running for ten years.

Harris would like to have continuous growth of his livestock business, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. He will use this loan to buy two piglets and hog feed for their daily maintenance. He hopes to make his business more profitable so he can help his parents in generating funds for their family needs.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and hog feed.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 35-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and three sons and daughters. All of her children are students while her husband is a government employee. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Farzana is trying to help him meet their needs by stitching clothes at home. 

She is an efficient tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. As a member of a 10-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. 

If she gets a good amount of profit, she will open a tailoring shop in the market in the future, as currently she is operating her business at her home. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. 

Note: In the picture Farzana holds a BRAC Pakistan pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine sells onions, garlic and bananas inside Santiago's public market. She lives with her long-term partner and their two children. She has been running her rented stall since 1986. She is thankful that she has been able to cover all of her household needs and gain better profits for such a long period of time. Now, she would like a loan of 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of bananas, onions and garlic. Josephine is hoping for continuous financial support from lenders so she can satisfy customer demand and obtain greater income for her family's sustenance and well-being. In addition, she wants to educate her two children and give them a bright future someday.

In the business picture, the client is wearing a yellow shirt while the project officer in-charge is wearing white and violet.

loans.use: to buy stocks of onions, bananas and garlic for her stall.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 56-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. Three of them are school going while others help Gulshan in her business. 

Two years ago, she faced a very difficult time because the income earned from her husband was not sufficient to meet the expenses of the household. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own sweater-knitting business. She bought bundles of wool in different colors from the market at lower rates and started knitting for the people living around her. She now has a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors.
  
She has gradually improved her business. Now she requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She is going to use this loan to buy packs of needles and bundles of wool in different colors to increase her sales to the local market during winter season. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education and house improvement.

loans.use: To buy packs of needles and bundles of wool in different colors.

loans.name: Jumanah

texts.en: Jumanah is a 30-year-old married woman who supports three family members in Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy a sewing machine, as she would like to make clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes to expand her project  in the future, in order to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amjd

texts.en:
Amjd is a 31-year-old married man and has two children. He works in the field and grows different seasonal crops. He also sells sheep in the animal market. He lives in Aden, Yemen. He started his business by buying a car, and then he collected some money to buy sheep. He takes care of his household responsibilities. 

Amjd has applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB for further improvement of his animal-selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy sheep in larger numbers. That will help him with fulfilling the requirements of local butchers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy sheep in larger numbers for his business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Ms  Zareena is s 33-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has had a business of selling popcorn for four years.  She initiated her business by buying a small cart with the support of Kashf Foundation. The man shown in the photo is Zareena’s husband and one of her daughters is also shown in the photo. Her husband assists her in selling popcorn door-to door. They serve well in their community and count a good client list. 

In order to buy stocks of ingredients such as packs of corn, oil and salt, Zareena requested a loan of Rs. 30,000. In this way they will be able to increase their sales. Zareena dreams of providing her children with a good quality education for their better future.

loans.use: To buy stocks of ingredients such as packs of corn, oil and salt.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 27-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, 2 sons, and a daughter. All of her children are students, while her husband is a painter. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Yasmeen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She is a very efficient and hardworking tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine.  

As a member of a 10-person lending group she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help her to increase her business but to increase her net income and savings as well. With the profit and savings amount she wants to purchase her own house, as they are currently living in a rented house. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this kindness. Note: In the picture Yasmeen is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old hard-working and independent woman who lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, son, and  daughter. Both of the children are students while her husband is a rickshaw driver whose income is insufficient to cover their household expenses. 

Naseem herself has been running a beauty salon for two years. As a member of a 10-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc. as well as chairs for her salon. With the profits she will first pay back her loan to Kiva, and will put aside some savings for children's future. 

Naseem dreams of opening a new beauty parlour and getting good profits from that. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative. Note: In the picture, Naseem holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase variety of cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 28-year-old married woman who supports three family members in Nao'or, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy materials for her beauty salon, such as a hair dryer, a skin cleaning machine and cosmetic products. She hopes in the future to expand her project to increase her family income.
Since Shireen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment and products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 31-year-old man. He is married and a father of four children; they live in Ibb, Yemen. He has a van which is used for transportation. It is their main source of income. He would like to repair his van so he can cover the family's needs. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his van. Taking out this loan will enable him to be more profitable and will lead to improving his living conditions. He hopes to enroll his children in school and open a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 48-year-old widow who is engaged in a sari-sari store business. She has been in this business for three years. Being a single parent to her three children is very difficult, but Juliana brings her best to meet her children's needs. Aside from her sari-sari store, Juliana engaged herself in a hog-raising business. She has been doing this for almost three years. 

Right now, Juliana is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, noodles and kitchen ingredients for her store, and to buy feed and vaccine for her hogs. In the future, she wants to have good financial management and continue acquiring good income from her businesses. She wants to save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and kitchen ingredients for her store, and to buy feed and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 42-year-old man who lives in Aden, Yemen, with his two children whom he loves and are his main reason for living. He is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic, and he makes every effort to come out ahead. He applied for a loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy a rickshaw for transportation. He hopes to open a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for transportation.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 30-year-old hardworking housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters and a son in Punjab, Pakistan. All of her children are students. Since 2008, her husband has been running his own general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business so that he can increase his net income.

 For that reason,  his wife Shazia, as a member of a 10-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will help her husband to purchase a variety of products like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, crockery, etc. for the general store, to satisfy the needs of his customers more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

 Shazia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. She dreams that her children will have a better and successful future. Note: In the picture, Shazia holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hard working mother who aims to improve her family's standard of living, to satisfy her family's needs, and to finance the education of her five children. She and her family live happily in a village, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Teresa wants to improve her small variety store to increase her income. 

Due to insufficient capital, Teresa is asking for an additional loan of PHP 12,000 to buy bread, junk food, canned goods, toothpaste, soaps, candies, and beverages for resale. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business as she continue to work hard. In the future, Teresa is hoping that her business will grow and her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy bread, junk food, canned goods, toothpaste, soaps, candies, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 42-year-old married woman who supports five family members in Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy chicken to resell in the same area that she wants to expand her project. In the future, she hopes to open a chicken farm to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy chicken to resell

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en: Ms Kouser is 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She is been in the business of making soccer balls for eight years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality products. She earns enough to meet the expenses of her family members. Kouser is contributing much of the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient by itself to meet the needs of the family members. She is able to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. In order to improve her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of Rs. 25,000. The loan proceeds will be used to buy an additional sewing machine, as she is engaging many other women to assist her in completing orders on time, and to buy raw materials such as rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities, in order to serve more customers without delay. She is hoping to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine and large quantities of raw materials for making soccer balls, such as rubber bladders and leather covers, in order to engage other women to help in her business.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: For cultural reasons, Rawan prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet, so the above photo is of her husband. Rawan, under 33, is a married woman who has four family members in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy cosmetic products and perfumes to sell to friends and neighbors in her area. She wants expand her project in the future by opening a shop, and she hopes to buy a new home for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and perfumes to sell to her friends and neighbors.

loans.name: Zaiba

texts.en:
Ms. Zaiba is 52-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she had started her own business of cloth selling when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys cloth of different designs from market in bulk at lower rates and sells it in her community. She counts a good client list, most her clients are her neighbors.
  
Zaiba is a mother of four children. Three of them are school-going. She wishes to send the other one to school but is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business, and now she has requested a loan of Rs.20,000. She is going to use this loan to buy a great variety of cloth in larger quantity to add to her current stock, considering the taste and choice of her customers. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy a great variety of cloth in larger quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en:
Hajiran is a 55-year-old widow. She is a mother of three children and she is motivated to provide for her family. 

Hajiran has been successfully running a small general store with her son for the last ten years. The man shown in the photo is her son. Hajiran offers various goods for daily use in her store and has gained many regular customers. Her son assists in buying stocks of goods from the markets and he has maintained many contacts for the ease of cash payments.  Because Hajiran wants to grow her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She will thereby be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Hajiran wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 44 years old and has five school-age children. As a responsible wife, she set up a small variety store in their village to help her husband to generate income. Despite the hardship they face, she and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and become professionals someday. Thus, she and her husband aim to improve their status so that they can finance their children's education and provide all their necessities. 

To increase the family's income, Nena wants to expand her product offerings to satisfy customer demand. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy goods such as breads, canned goods, soaps, noodles, junk food, and soft drinks. She believes that this loan will allow her to improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in fulfilling her plans.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store such as breads, canned goods, soaps, noodles, junk food and beverages

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 42 year-old widow. She is the mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She wishes the other one could go to school, but she is unable to cover the expenses. 

Ten years ago, Jameela started her own business of clothing sales when her husband passed away. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys clothes of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. She has a good client list and most of her clients are her neighbors. Jameela has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 15,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current stock. She intends to use the profits she earns for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulties, Letecia sells vegetables to supplement her husband's income. She is 51 years old and has eight grown-up children. With her husband, they aim to improve the business so that they will earn sufficient income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their two youngest children. Letecia and her husband want their children to earn a degree so that they will find good jobs someday. 

Letecia is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, pechay, beans, squash, onions and eggplants. She is hoping that someday she will improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, pechay, beans, squash, onions and eggplants for sale

loans.name: Laraib's Group

texts.en:
Laraib is 23 years old and a hard-working and independent woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and son and daughter. Both of the children are students, while her husband is a tailor who has operated his own tailoring shop since 2008. His income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

So to help her husband, Laraib has been running a beauty salon for the past two years. Laraib wants to increase her business by purchasing some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. As a member of a 10-person lending group, Laraib has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. When she earns a profit, she will first repay the loan and then she will save to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too crowded. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very thankful to both BRAC and Kiva. 

Note: In the picture, Laraib is carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs.

loans.name: Irum's Group

texts.en:
Irum is 28 years old and a hard-working and independent woman. She is lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons, both of whom are students. Her husband is a carpenter, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

Since 2009, Irum has been running a beauty salon. She wants to purchase some more cosmetic products, such as hair straighteners and beauty creams, as well as chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Irum, as a member of an eight-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Once she earns a profit, she will first repay the loan to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too crowded. Irum hopes that her business grows more. Her biggest dream in life is to go for an Umrah (pilgrimage). She is very thankful to Kiva. 

Note: In the picture Irum is carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products, such as hair straighteners and beauty creams, as well as furniture for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Wanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS,el banco pertenece al distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Wanda tiene 30 años de edad,01 hijo y es soltera,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lenceria,ropa de baño,medias entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un local por el centro de la ciudad ,ella trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 09:00am hasta las 08:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como truzas al por mayor para mujeres .
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the MICAELA BASTIDAS communal bank, located within the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Wanda is 30 years old, single, and has a son.  She sells lingerie, bath clothing, socks and stockings, among other things, and has been doing this for years.  Things have gone well for her, thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She has a shop in the city center and works there seven days a week, from about 9:00am to 8:00pm.  She is a responsible, enterprising woman and gets her family ahead in this way.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy merchandise in quantity, such as ladies’ trusses 

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. To support the needs of her family, Fatima started a sewing business 15 years ago. Both Fatima and her husband are working to earn a respectable living. Fatima is strongly motivated to support her family, so she also started making fancy hand-made fans for her customers to earn additional income. Fatima is working to improve the living standards of her family and to meet their basic needs adequately. She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy cloth patterns, buttons, fancy mirrors, sequins, and threads so that she can run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy cloth patterns, buttons, fancy mirrors, sequins, and threads.

loans.name: Ambreen's Group

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 23-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, daughter and son. Her son is a one-year-old, and her daughter is ten and in the fifth grade. Her husband is a painter, and his income is not sufficient to meet all the household expenses.

Ambreen is a very hardworking and independent woman. By sewing clothes, she helps her husband to provide for the family's needs and her children's education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly, for the past two years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Ambreen, is a member of an eight-person borrowing group that has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With her share of the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine, so that she can work more efficiently in the future. Ambreen and her family live in a rented house; she dreams of living in her own home. She also wants to increase her business and to provide a quality education to her children. She is very thankful to the BRAC and Kiva teams.

Note: In the picture, Ambreen is holding a pass book.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Ms. Anwar is 54 years old and a married woman. She started a small general store in her home one year ago. She started this business when she realized that her husband's income is not sufficient for her family and their needs are growing. So she decided to open a general store in a corner of her house to make it convenient for the people living around her.  

It’s been a year and she has received good response from the area in which she is living. Most of the children and day-to-day customers come to her store to shop. They like her dealings and she has gained respect in the town. 

Anwar now wants to expand her store by purchasing more stocks of sugar, flour, rice, pulses and packs of toffees and biscuits, etc. so that she can better earn profit from this store. She has applied with Kashf foundation for a loan of 30,000 Rs so that she can meet the demands of her customers consistently. She hopes to earn more net income and hence better support the needs of the family members.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of sugar, flour, rice, pulses (lentils) and packs of toffees and biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old, married, and has three school-age children. She and her family live happily in a rural community where they are able to plant rice and vegetables and raise livestock for resale. They help each other in earning income to support the education of the children and to give them a better life. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Marissa needs to increase her income to cover their necessities and pay for the education of her children. 

Marissa buys and sells rice in her community to generate additional income. She is asking for an additional loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of rice for resale. She believes that someday she will improve her business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice for resale

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en: Izdehar is a 38-year-old married woman who has three family members and lives in Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to repaint her home and do other maintenance of the home. She hopes in the future to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvemenst

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Huda prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Huda is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Jordan. She has a child.  She has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes and blankets. In the future, Huda is planning to improve the financial and living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothes and blankets

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Manuela, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, los cuales los cría para engorde y luego los comercializa. Manuela en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar padrillos de cuyes y gallinas para capitalizar su actividad. Manuela está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio el cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the communal bank Las Triunfadoras in the district of Andahuaylillas, province of Quispicanchis of Cusco, Peru. She is a hardworking mother of a family. 

She continues working breeding small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs which she grows and fattens and later sells. 

Manuela is now asking for a loan in order to buy breeding guinea pigs and chickens in order to take good advantage of her activity. Manuela is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to strengthen her business which permits her to sustain her household.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens which she plans to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a 46-year-old independent woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, two daughters and four sons. Her husband is running a boutique shop and all his sons help him in the business. 

Since 2007, Shameem herself has been running an embroidery business and now she wants to expand her business so that she can increase her net income. For that reason and as a member of a 10-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase embroidery materials like cloth, needles and accessories, so that she can work more professionally and efficiently and can easily grow her business. 

Shameem dreams of her children's better future and her husband's good health. She wants to live a good and simple life with her family. Salam and many thanks from her to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. Note: In the picture Shameem is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material for her business.

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Marriam prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Marriam is a 47-year-old married woman who has seven family members and comes from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and to do maintenance on her home. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a responsible housewife who helps her husband in generating income. She is 34 years old and has three school-aged children. As a way of gaining income, she engages in buying and selling scrap materials in their community. Having no competitors in the area, she aims to continue and strengthen the business. She plans to buy more scrap materials for sale but she has not enough capital, therefore, she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy bottles, plastics and other scrap materials for sale. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she can improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bottles, plastics and other scrap materials for sale

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Sahar prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet, so the above photo is of her husband.

Sahar is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa in Amman, Jordan. She has six children and has requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. Sahar is looking forward to improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses and buy furniture.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Eman prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet, so the above photo is of her husband.

Eman is a 26-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Jordan. She has three children. She has requested a 900 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. In the future, Eman is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS,el banco pertenece al distrito de Cusco,departamento de Cusco,provincia de Cusco.
La socia Martina tiene 37 años de edad,conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de caldos,la socia cuenta con un local lugar donde vende los caldos para sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia trabaja todos los dias durante el dia ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como diferentes tipos de carne,papa entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Martina is a member of the MICAELA BASTIDAS communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, department of Cusco, province of Cusco. Martina is 37 years old with a partner and two children. She varies her daily activities with a business selling soups. She has a small locale where she sells soups for her customers. She has been working in this business for a long time and she has been doing very well because of her daily dedication to her business. She works every day during the day. She is responsible and hard-working, which is how she can move ahead with her family.

Martina will use the loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as different types of meat and potatoes. She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business, such as different types of meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Justina, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y multifacética, ella continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, a la venta de leña y también vende piedras las cuales extrae de una cantera que posee en su terreno. Justina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar alimento como forraje, alfalfa y sutuche (comida para cerdos a base de maíz) para sus animales. Justina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio el cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Justina belongs to the communal bank Las Triunfadoras located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province of Quispicanchis in Cusco, Peru. She is a hardworking and multifaceted woman. 

She continues working breeding small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs, selling firewood, and also she sells stones from a quarry in the field. 

Justina is now asking for a loan in order to buy food such as forage, alfalfa and sutuche (feed for pigs from a corn base) for her animals. Justina is very grateful to Kiva for permitting her to strengthen her business which allows her to sustain her home.

loans.use: to buy feed for her barnyard animals

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Rana prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Rana is a 30-year-old married female from Baqa'a in Jordan. She has three children and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. In the future, Rana is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 54-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to buy women's and children's clothes and shoes to sell; she wants to increase her product range. In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en: Samina is a 42-year-old, independent, woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, three daughters and a son. All her children are students. Her husband is an auto mechanic who has been running his own shop since 2007. Her husband's income is insufficient to cover the household expenses. Since 2010, Samina has been trying to help her husband by running a boutique. She purchases a variety of clothes from different cities, such as Lahore and Faisalabad, and sells them to customers in Rawalpindi. Now she is interested in growing her business. As a member of a seven-person borrowing group, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy more clothes and sewing supplies. This will help her to work more professionally and efficiently, and to offer a wider variety of products to her customers. She dreams of a better future for her children and of good health for her husband. She wants to live a good, simple, life with her family. Salam, and many thanks, from her to all staff members of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. Note: In the picture, Samina has a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Maryam prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet, so the above photo is of her brother.

Maryam is a 23-year-old single woman from Baqa'a, Jordan. She has requested a 1500 JOD loan to finance retailing of clothes, accessories, blankets and cosmetics. In the future, Maryam is planning to expand her business, with her brother, and to improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Maryam is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to finance retailing of clothes, accessories, blankets and cosmetics

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Nawal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Nawal is a 37-year-old married woman who supports three family members from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to repaint her home and to do maintenance on the home. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is a 32-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has two children and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. Ola is planning to install a new kitchen and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Roxana Yenny

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Roxana, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con su actividad económica en la elaboración de artesanías, principalmente en la elaboración de muñecas de trapo con trajes típicos. Roxana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar material como telas, lanas llicllas (telas con motivos andinos) e hilos, para que la elaboración de sus muñecas.
Roxana está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo brindarles una mejor vida y  educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras" [The Winners] from the district of Andahuaylillas, within the province of Quispicanchis in Cusco - Perú. She continues with her business making art crafts, especially making rag dolls wearing traditional dresses. 

Roxana will use this loan to buy material, such as fabric, wool with Andean motifs [llicllas], and thread to make the dolls.

She's very grateful with KIVA for their support with her business, which helps to bring a better life and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as fabric, wool, and thread.

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en: Kafa is a 35-year-old married woman who supports three family members and comes from Nao'or, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy cosmetic products to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area. She wants to increase her product range. She hopes to expand her project.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS,el banco esta situado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco,departamento de Cusco.
El socio Hermenegildo tiene 39 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpinteria ,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio trabaja de lunes a sabado en su taller,el socio elabora diferentes tipos de trabajos como camas,armarios,reposteros entre otros,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de madera para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank Micaela Bastidas, the bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.
Hermenegildo is 39, married has two children, he manages his daily activities with a carpentry shop, he's been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into the business each and every day.  He works from Monday to Saturday at his shop making different types of furniture such as beds, cabinets, shelfs and others.  He is a responsible and hard working person being this his way to get his family ahead.  He requests a loan to buy wood for his business.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wood for his business.

loans.name: Amaal

texts.en: Amaal is a 28-year-old married woman who supports three family members and comes from Nao'or, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements; she wants to buy new furniture and to buy some other household items. She would like in the future to do maintenance on the home to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 20-year-old, single female from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for opening a beauty salon inside her home, and buying the needed tools. In the future, Abeer is planning to open her own salon and improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Abeer is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for opening a beauty salon in her own house

loans.name: Moutaz

texts.en:
Moutaz is a 24-year-old, single male from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. He requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for the expenses of his graduation project in university. In the future, Moutaz is planning to improve the living conditions of his family.

Since Moutaz is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his graduation project expenses

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Raeda prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Raeda is a 35-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buying some furniture. In the future, Raeda is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en: Marriam is a 34-year-old, married woman who has 4 family members from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a 53-year-old, married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has 8 children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. In the future, Zainab is planning to buy or rent another home which is bigger for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Amal prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Amal is a 33-year-old, married female from Ashrafia. She has 4 children and requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Luisa, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos. Luisa en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar gallinas y cuyes, además de alimento como forraje, alfalfa y sutuche (comida para cerdos a base de maíz) para sus animales. Luisa desea proporcionar a sus hijos una mejor educación superior y precisamente para ellos se sacrifica, por ello está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio el cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras" [The Winners] from the district of Andahuaylillas, within the Quispicanchis province of Cusco, Perú. She is a very hard worker and continues to breed smaller animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. 

Luisa will use this loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs, as well as animal feed, such as fodder, alfalfa and "sutuche" [a corn-based feed for pigs] for her animals. Luisa wishes to provide her children with a better education, which is why she makes sacrifices. She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to strengthen her trade so that she can support her household.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: Ehdaa

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Ehdaa prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet, so the above photo is of her sister.

Ehdaa is a 20-year-old single woman from Al Karak in Jordan. She has requested a 600 JOD loan to finance retailing of clothes. In the future, Ehdaa is planning to have her own shop and improve the living and financial conditions of her family.

Since Ehdaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to finance retailing of clothes.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMISTAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Nancy ella es soltera y tiene 46 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de limpieza,la socia vende detergentes,escobillas y esponjas,la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria vendiendo en la puerta del mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 4 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de limpieza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar detergentes, escobillas y esponjas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de muebles, negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “Amistad.” This bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

Nancy is single, 46 years old, and has one son. She works selling cleaning products. She sells detergents, brushes and sponges. She works as a traveling sales person, selling at the entrance to the market. She works from 8:00AM until 5:00PM. She has been in this business for four years and it’s going very well. Her dream is to have her own facility where she can sell cleaning products. She is asking for a loan to buy detergents, brushes and sponges.

The members that are attached to the group photo had their picture taken later because of work related reasons.

The other members work in furniture sales, restaurant businesses, clothing sales, and sales of beauty products.

The member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream through this means and she promises to make her payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy detergents, brushes and brushes at wholesale prices to sell in her business

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is 25 years old and a married woman and mother of two. She is young and energetic. She is eager to provide her family a better living. She wants to fulfill basic necessities for her children including food, healthcare and education. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living. 

Sajida has had a business of stitching for two years. It’s also her second year with Kashf Foundation. Through the support of Kashf Foundation, she is fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s education. Now, she has requested a loan of Rs.30,000 to buy raw materials including cloth, threads in different colors and packs of needles. In this way she can handle the growing demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy raw material including cloth, thread in different colors, and packs of needles.

loans.name: Rasha Group

texts.en: The group is called Rasha and consists of four ladies. The group coordinator is Ebtsam. She is 38 years old and sells a variety of clothing, incense and perfumes, etc.. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is a hardworking person who is pleased with the opportunity that has been given to her. She applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy a variety of clothes, incense and perfumes, etc. that she can offer to her customers and thereby increase her earnings. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes, incense and perfumes, etc. for her business

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 29-year-old, single female from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Remah

texts.en: Remah is a 44-year-old, divorced female from Al Nasser in Jordan. She has 6 children and requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes. In the future, Remah is planning to have her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothes

loans.name: Firyal

texts.en:
Firyal is a 28-year-old single woman from Al Karak in Jordan. She requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for making cheese and dairy products. 

In the future, Firyal is planning to expand her project and improve her living conditions.

Since Firyal is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for making cheese and dairy products.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en: Nariman is a 23-year-old, married woman who supports 1 family member from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 58-year-old married woman who has one family member and comes from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to buy blankets and accessories to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. In the future she hopes to open a shop to expand her project.

loans.use: to buy blankets and accessories to resell

loans.name: Odet Allah

texts.en: Odet Allah is a 54-year-old married male from Al Karak in Jordan. He has five children and requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for construction supplies to retail. in the future, Odet Allah is planning to expand his project.

loans.use: to retail construction supplies

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Gabriela, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con su actividad económica en la venta de comida en un puesto del mercado de su comunidad, y de esta manera ayuda a su esposo quien también tiene un trabajo muy sacrificado como es la confección de ropa. Gabriela en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar los insumos como arroz, fideos, verduras, menestras etc, que le permitan elaborar sus platos de comida y así capitalizar su actividad.
Gabriela está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hagar.
texts.en:
