They own 3 pigs, a calf and 3 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Furthermore, the family owns agricultural land and a vineyard. They grow different kinds of vegetables and pick grapes in the late summer. Ekaterine produces wine and vodka. She sells the agricultural products and dairy locally. Ekaterine is a very hard-working woman with a great experience in her work.

She requested a loan to renovate her house. Her existing house is old and damaged. Ekaterine will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, her family's living conditions will improve and they will be able to spend their evenings in a more comfortable environment after a hard day of work. Ekaterine hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Sana prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Sana is a 47-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 5 children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. In the future, Sana is looking forward to improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Myasar prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Myasar is a 48-year-old married woman who has 5 family members from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to buy cleaning products to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. The loan will allow her to increase the number of products that she sells. She hopes in the future to expand her business by opening a shop in which to show her products.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to resell.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 21-year-old single female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has requested a 499 JOD loan so she can retail mobile accessories and prepaid cards. In the future, Amani is planning to expand her business in order to help her parents improve the family's living conditions. 

Since Amani is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in mobile accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Eudocia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el negocio de venta de de chicha de jora y también a la crianza de animales menores. Eudocia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar Jora para la elaboración de chicha y también comprará algunos animales de corral como cuyes y gallinas para engorde y su posterior comercialización en el mercado  de su comunidad.
Eudocia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en: Eudocia’s a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Victorious Ones) communal bank in Andahuaylillas District in Quispicanchis Province in Cusco, Peru.  She continues selling ‘chicha de jora’ [fermented corn beverage] and also raising small farm animals.  On this occasion, Eudocia needs the loan to buy purple corn to make chicha and also to buy some barnyard animals like guinea pigs and chicks to fatten up and then sell in the local market.  Eudocia is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to stay in business and by means of her work provide support for her home.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicks and corn.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 46-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 4 children.

Maryam has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. Maryam is planning to put new water pipes in her kitchen and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 36-year-old married woman who has seven family members; from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to repaint her home and to do maintenance on the home. She hopes in the future to expand her home and to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Elsa mujer de 28 años que se dedica a comercializar artículos de trastes plásticos desde hace 4 años, inicio su negocio vendiendo frito, atol de maíz, tamales y con sus ganancias fue invirtiendo en trastes plásticos y como le fue mejor se dedicó totalmente a su línea de negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos plásticos como pana, tinas, baldes, platos, cucharas etc. Martha vende platanitos ambulantes y Teresa tiene una pequeña pulpería en su domicilio y vende leñas.
texts.en:
This is a group consisting of three entrepreneur members. One of them is Elsa, a woman of 28 years old and devoted to commercialize plastic utensils for four years. She started her business selling fried food, atole of corn, and tamales, and she invested the profits in plastic utensils. Because she was doing better with that, she totally devoted to this line of business.

The credit will be invested on the purchase of plastic utensils such as small containers, large jars, buckets, plates, spoons, etc. Martha sells bananas as a street peddler and Teresa has a small grocery store in her home, where she sells firewood.

loans.use: to purchase plastic utensils such as small containers, large jars, buckets, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años en que enviudo Elisa, desde entonces es padre y madre de sus 4 hijos con quienes cumplió este doble rol a pesar de las dificultades, hoy son su soporte emocional mas grande que existe, uno de ellos ya independiente ayuda con los mas pequeños que aún están en etapa escolar. Habitan en una casa de adobe cuyo objetivo a largo plazo es construirla con cemento y ladrillos. Tuvo una época en donde desempeño actividades en el campo con el cual logró acumular cierto capital y cumplió uno de sus objetivos que fue el del comercio de ropas donde ya se desempeña desde hace 2 años. Es un negocio cuyo campo laboral requiere desplazarse por distintos lugares y es lo que a ella mas le gusta, pues le permite conocer mucha gente y pasar experiencias que motivan su trabajo. Dentro de los productos mas comerciales tiene actualmente los polos y las blusas cuya demanda esta en aumento y conocedora de buenos gustos opta en ocasiones por vender toda su mercadería, esto la esta motivando a seguir desempeñándose como tal adquiriendo mayor cantidad de prendas al por mayor. 
Uno de sus objetivos también es abrir una tienda de prendas en su vivienda para así crecer como comerciante.
Sus parcelas las encomendó a Edwin su hijo, quien hasta hoy la trabaja y le da la atención que requiere para así juntos apoyar en lo posible a los menores cuya actividad estudiantil superior requiere de mucho apoyo. Este es su crédito número 15 con el cual se siente comprometida y agradecida por la confianza brindada, a su vez se siente agradecida también con sus compañeros de su banco comunal quienes la asesoran e informar sobre  algunos puntos referentes a su crédito con el cual se siente confiada y segura de invertirlos.
Con los 2,000 soles otorgados realizará la compra de prendas de vestir al por mayor dentro de los cuales destacaran los polos y las blusas.
texts.en:
Since Elsa was widowed ten years ago she’s been mother and father to her four children; she met this dual role despite difficulties.  Today, they are the greatest emotional support she has.  One of them is already independent and helps her with the younger ones who are still school age.  They live in an adobe house and her long-term goal is to build it with cement and bricks.  

There was a time when she worked doing agricultural work in the fields and managed to save up some capital reaching one of her goals which was to sell clothes; she’s now been doing this for two years.  It’s a business that requires her to move from place to place and that’s what she likes best because she gets to meet many people and go through experiences that motivate her to work.  Among her best-selling items are shirts and blouses; demand for them is on the rise and since she’s a good judge of taste she often sells out all her merchandise.  This motivates her to continue developing and acquiring larger amounts of clothes at wholesale.  One of her objectives is to open a clothing store at home in order to grow as a merchant.

She left her son Edwin in charge of her fields and to date he works them and gives them the necessary attention so that they can support the younger children whose higher education activities require much support.

This is her 15th loan and she feels committed and grateful for the trust placed in her.  At the same time, she’s grateful to her fellow communal bank members who advise her and inform her on points related to her loan so she feels confident and sure about her investments.  She will use the granted 2,000 soles to buy clothing at wholesale among which blouses and shirts will be prominent.

loans.use: to buy shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Valentina, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose al comercio de alimentos como actividad principal y fuente de ingresos económicos,y tambien aprovecha para vender verduras en su puesto ambulante que tiene en el mercado de la comunidad, y de esta manera ayuda a su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción. Valentina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como papas, huevos, arroz entre otros y tambien verduras como tomates, zanahorias, habas, arvejas, papas etc.para vender en el mercado. Valentina desea poder ayudar sobre todo a su esposo, quien está haciendo los modos posibles para ahorrar y adquirir una maquina mezcladora de cemento y de esta manera lograr aumentar conjuntamente sus ingresos económicos para ofrecerle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina’s a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Victorious Ones) communal bank in Andahuaylillas District in Quispicanchis Province in Cusco, Peru.  She’s a very hardworking woman who continues selling food as her main activity and source of income.  She also sells vegetables in a stand she has at the local market.  She helps her husband who works in construction this way.

On this occasion, Valentina is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, eggs and rice among others and also to buy vegetables like tomatoes, carrots, lima beans, peas, potatoes, etc. to sell in the market.

Valentina most of all wants to help her husband who is doing everything he can to save up to buy a cement mixer so that together the two of them can increase income to provide better education for their children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Hala prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother.

Hala is a 26-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has two children and requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing clothes. In the future, Hala is planning to expand her project by opening her own shop. 

Since Hala is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing clothes

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Najat prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Najat is a 30-year-old married woman who supports two family members; from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to buy a new electronic appliance such as an LCD screen. In the future she hopes to develop her home and to provide her family with a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to buy a new electronic appliance such as an LCD screen

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in a small village of the Sachkhere district. Her family is large: She has a husband, 2 children (20 and 11 years old) and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. The whole family is involved in agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 milk cows and 5 calves. They produce cheese and sell it locally. They also slaughter cattle and sell the meat to meat retailers. 

In addition, the family owns 1.7 hectares of land where they grow maize, haricots and produce hay for feeding the cattle. Besides that, the family provides a service for local people with their own electric mill and grinds their corn. All members of the family work hard to improve their living conditions.

Lia requested a loan to repair her house. After repairing the house, their ability to work harder will increase. Thus, it will increase their profit and Lia will be able to expand her business and satisfy more customers. She awaits your support

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Diana prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Diana is a 30-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 5 children and requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing clothes. In the future, Diana is planning to expand her project and increase sales.

loans.use: to pay for retailing clothes

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Timotea, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, la socia compra terneros, los engorda y posteriormente los vende. Timotea en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar 2 toretes, criarlos y posteriormente comercializarlos en el mercado  de su comunidad.
Timotea está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en: Timotea’s a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Victorious Ones) communal bank in Andahuaylillas District in Quispicanchis Province in Cusco, Peru.  She’s continues with the business of buying and selling cattle.  She buys calves, fattens them up and then sells them.  On this occasion, Timotea needs the loan to buy two bullocks to raise to subsequently sell in her community’s market.  Timotea is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to stay in business and by means of her work provide support for her home.

loans.use: to buy two bullocks.

loans.name: Dúo Amor Y Fé Group

texts.es: Dúo amor y Fé. Doña Cayetana de 62 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos tipicos, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años ha sido una persona muy bendecida por Dios ya que le a dado la oportunidad de tener la habilidad de tejer ropa tipica, ahora ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos a mano.
texts.en:
“Love and Faith” Duo.

Cayetana, 62, manufactures traditional textiles; she’s been doing this for several years.  She’s been blessed by God because He’s given her the opportunity of having the skill to weave traditional clothing. She’s now requesting this loan to buy raw materials needed to hand-weave traditional textiles.

loans.use: to buy raw materials used to hand weave traditional textiles.

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores Zoila su negocio es compra y venta de cerdo en pie, destaza y hace nacatamales actividad que  viene realizando desde hace desde hace 10 años, inicia haciendo nacatamales la carne de cerdo le sale a menor costo su destaza el cerdo por lo que miro una oportunidad de ver mas ganancias, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie, materia prima de nacatamal  como es la hoja, arroz, papa, producto perecederos, especies etc,Melenciana hecha y vende tortillas en su domicilio, Zenobia tiene una pulpería en su casa y vende enchilada, Ignacio vende hojas de chagüites para hacer nacatamales.
texts.en:
This is a group of four enterprising members.  Zoila’s business is buying and selling pigs.  She also butchers them and makes nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales], an activity she’s been in for ten years.  She starts out making pork nacatamales.  The meat costs her less if she butchers the pigs herself which is an opportunity for her to increase profits.

She will use the loan to buy live pigs and raw materials like leaves, rice, potatoes, perishables, spices, etc. to make nacatamales.  

Melenciana makes and sells tortillas at home, Zenobia has a grocery store at home and sells enchiladas and Ignacio sells banana leaves to make nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy pigs and raw materials for tamales.

loans.name: Badria

texts.en:
Badria is a 29-year-old married woman who has two family members; from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy women's and children's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She wants to increase her product range. In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her income. 

Since Badria is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Roqaya

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Roqaya prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Roqaya is a 23-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has a child and she requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buying some furniture. In the future, Roqaya is planning to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from a small village of Kareli district. She is 60 years old and lives with her large family: her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her daughter-in-law works as a teacher at the local school and earns a monthly salary. Manana’s family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 milk cows and 2 calves. They produce cheese and sell it locally. 

In addition, Manana grows broiler hens and sells them at a good price. The family owns 2 hectares of land, where they grow maize, potatoes and carrots. The harvested products are sold to local retailers. They have 30 years' experience in this field and do all the work together to improve their living conditions.

Manana requested a loan to purchase a plot of land. After buying another plot of land, she will expand her business and grow more vegetables. Thus she will receive increased income and reinvest in family agricultural activities. Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Sameera prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son.

Sameera is a 59-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 5 children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing clothes. In the future, Sameera is planning to expand her project by opening her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for retailing clothes

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Marciana de 39 años casada con Germán, madre de 2 hijos quienes ya mayores se desempeñan en actividades profesionales gracias al apoyo que recibieron. Todos ellos viven en una casa de madera construida en un terreno cuya compra se concreto hace poco. Se inició como productora de cacao desde siempre y con los años logró acumular capital de trabajo con el cual se inició en el negocio de los celulares. 
Alquilando un local en un centro comercial y con el apoyo de su hijo quien en adelante se instruyo en servicio técnico de los mismos, lograron sacar adelante el negocio convirtiéndolo en un buen sustento de su hogar. Adicional a ello también aprovechan el local para venta de sandalias y otros. De esta manera se siente contento de trabajar madre e hijo conformando un equipo y teniendo a su padre dirigiendo las actividades agropecuarias.
En los últimos meses notaron cierta disminución en las ventas puesto que la gente opta por adquirir celulares con características adicionales y es necesario surtir el negocio de tal manera que se cumpla la demanda.  
Dentro de sus planes a futuro desea concretar la construcción de su casa con material noble en donde planea seguir con el negocio. Lleva consigo su crédito número 16 para el cual se siente comprometida con el cumplimiento de sus pagos, comenta también que le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal debido a que se siente más informada y motivada a la vez. Con su préstamo por 1,000 soles complementará su capital para compra de equipos celulares mas solicitados por el público así como accesorios y repuestos de los mismos.
texts.en:
Marciana, 39, is married to Germán and is the mother of two children who are adults and carry out professional activities thanks to the support they received.  They all live in a wood house built on a piece of land they bought recently.  She started out as a cocoa bean farmer and over the years saved up working capital she used to start a mobile phone business.

Renting a commercial space and with support from her son who trained as a mobile phone technician they are able to move the business forward turning it into a good source of household support.  In addition, they also take advantage of their commercial space to sell sandals and other things.  In this way she feels happy to work as a mother-son team while the father manages the agricultural and animal husbandry activities.

They notices a bit of a drop in sales lately because people prefer to buy mobile phones with additional features so they need to stock the store in such a way to meet this demand.

Among her future plans is to build her house with substantial materials where she plans to continue with her business.  This is her 16th loan and she feels committed to making her payments.  She comments that she likes working in her communal bank because she feels better informed and more motivated each time.  She will use the 1,000 soles to add to her capital to buy the mobile phone equipment that’s most in demand by the public as well as accessories and spare parts for them.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 34-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has two children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing clothes. In the future, Eman is planning to expand her project by opening her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for retailing clothes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 52 años muy abnegada y trabajadora, apoya a su familia cuyos padres aun con ella tienen la dicha de tener una hija dedicada. Habita una casa de material noble que logró construir junto a sus hermanos para el bienestar de su familia. Desde hace 5 años dedicada a la crianza de abejas y producción de cacao, halló la clave de su progreso.  Aprovechando cierto espacio libre en sus parcelas inició tan solo con una caja según cuenta, tuvo éxito pues ya son 5 hasta hoy. Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que siente comprender a las abejas, aunque también recibió picaduras pero no le molesta puesto que indica es bueno para la salud.
La mejor manera para desempeñar esta labor y trabajar en armonía con las abejas, es estar siempre de buen humor comenta, puesto que ellas sienten ese instinto humano y es posible desempeñar esta actividad como cualquier otra. Dentro de sus prioridades planea ampliar su producción paralela a sus actividades agrícolas, por tanto tiene pensado comprar cajas de abeja así como almácigos de cacao con el cual seguirá acumulando capital en su afán de cumplir su objetivo que es adquirir mas parcelas para la producción de cacao. Su crédito número 05 logrado con MFP le da confianza en el trabajo que ella desempeña en tanto agradece a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la acogida que le brindaron para lograr ser parte del progreso grupal.
Con los 2,000 soles planea concretar la compra de cera para abeja, cajas de madera para crianza así como almácigos de cacao y abonos orgánicos para una optima producción.
texts.en:
María, 52, is very self-sacrificing and hardworking.  She supports her family. Her parents who are still with her are blessed to have such a devoted daughter.  She lives in a house built with substantial materials that she managed to build with her siblings for the family’s wellbeing.  

She’s worked for the last five years as a beekeeper and cocoa bean grower; she's found the key to success.  She took advantage of some free space in her parcels of land and started out with just one hive but with the success she had as of today she has five.  She likes her work very much because she feels like she understands the bees although she has been stung by them but that doesn’t bother her since she states that it’s good for your health.

The best way to do this work and to work in harmony with the bees is to always be in a good mood and happy because they can feel that human instinct and it’s possible to do this activity just like any other.  Among her priorities is to expand production alongside her agricultural activities.  Therefore, she plans to buy bee hives as well as cacao plant seedlings to continue accumulating capital to reach her objective of acquiring more land for cocoa bean production.

This is her 5th MFP loan and it gives her confidence in the work she does.  She thanks her communal bank members for the welcome they gave her when she became a member of the group.  She will use the 2,000 soles to buy a bee hive, wood boxes to raise bees as well as cacao plant seedlings and organic manure for optimum production.

loans.use: to buy beeswax, wood crates, cacao plant seedlings and organic manure.

loans.name: Las Pitaya Group

texts.es: Grupo formado formado por tres socios emprendedores que se dedican a sus actividades cada quien una de ellas es Mayra que se dedica a vender nacatamal y tiene una pulpería desde hace 6 años. Inicio su negocio vendiendo nacatamales y poco a poco fue invirtiendo su ganancia en productos como pan, café, arroz, aceite, chiverías en menor escala hasta lograr convertirla en pulpería, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de pulpería como arroz, frijoles, aceite, jabón de lavar, jabón de baños, papel higiénico, carne de res, carne de pollo etc. Martha vende ropa y cosméticos, Martin tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This is a group consisting of three entrepreneur members who are engaged to their activities. One of them is Mayra, who sells nacatamales [steamed meat and vegetable pasty, cooked in banana or maize leaves] and has a grocery store for six years. She started her business selling nacatamales and gradually invested the profits in products such as bread, coffee, rice, oil, and snacks in a small scale until turning it into a grocery store.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of grocery store products such as rice, beans, oil, laundry soap, bath soap, toilet paper, beef, chicken, etc. Martha sells clothes and cosmetics and Martin has a grocery store in his home.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, laundry soap, bath soap, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura de 41 años, una mujer emprendedora casada con Juan de 46 años  tienen consigo a 5 hijos, 2 de los cuales mayores llevan una vida independiente y responsable gracias a la buena formación que les inculco. Habita una casa de material noble que logro construir de a pocos con el apoyo de toda su familia. Desde hace 10 años halló en el cacao una buena fuente de ingreso para su familia, es por ello que lo sigue desempeñando con el firme apoyo de su esposo quien en ocasiones convoca a sus hijos para apoyar en labores menores. El proceso que mas le agrada es la cosecha ya que la entretiene mucho a diferencia del deshierbo debido a que considera es trabajo  de hombres y  engorroso a su vez.
Sus prioridades apuntan una necesidad de adquirir plantas de injerto para reemplazar plantaciones desfasadas evitando tener terreno obsoleto en  temporada próxima de producción. Asimismo adquirir abono orgánico el cual garantice obtener la calidad que los acopiadores suelen cotizar a buen precio.
Dentro de sus planes desea adquirir parcelas para  expandir su producción debido a que la zona donde se desempeña es terreno muy fértil  y garantiza una buena producción. El haber logrado su crédito número 06 con MFP, le permite a ella seguir produciendo con fluidez. Agradece  también a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por como se desempeñan con el tema del cumplimiento para el pago de sus cuotas.
Los 2,000 soles los destinará al pago de jornaleros y compra de plantas para injerto cuyo precio esta en oferta debido al  inicio de temporada, así como los sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Rosaura, 41, is an enterprising woman married to Juan, 46.  They have five children two of which are adults and live independent, responsible lives thanks to the good way they were raised.  She lives in a house built with substantial materials that she managed to build little by little with support from her entire family.

Ten years ago she discovered that cocoa beans were a good source of family income which is why she continues growing them with the firm support of her husband who sometimes gathers his children together to help with the lesser chores.  The process she likes best is harvesting because that’s very entertaining as opposed to weeding which she considers to be tedious men’s work.

Her priority is to acquire plants to graft in order to replace spent plants and not have obsolete land during the next growing season as well as to acquire organic manure that will guarantee the quality crop consolidators seek and pay good prices for.

Among her plans is to buy additional land to expand production because the zone she works in is very fertile and good harvests are a sure thing.  Having attained her 6th MFP loan allows her to continue producing fluidly.  She thanks her communal bank fellow members for the way they behave with respect to installment payments.  She will use the 2,000 soles to pay laborers and to buy plants to graft which are currently well-priced due to the season as well as to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to hire laborers, to buy cacao plant grafts and to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Dúo Los Llanos Group

texts.es: Dúo los Llanos, Lidia Marilu es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para salir adelante con su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de Joyas, y ropa de cama, como colchas sabanas etc. tambien se dedica al alquiler de sillas mesas para festividades ocacionales, de esa manera a podido ayudar a su familia, está solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas mercaderia en joyas y ropa de cama para la venta, tambien parte del crédito lo utilizará ára la compra de mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
This is the "Dúo los Llanos" group. Lidia Marilu is a very hard-working person who does her best to succeed in her business. She sells jewelry and bedding, such as mattresses, sheets, etc. She also rents chairs and tables for special occasions.

In this way she has been able to help her family. She is applying for the loan to buy more merchandise, such as jewelry and bedding to sell. As well, she will use part of the loan to buy tables and chairs.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as jewelry and bedding to sell.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Luz María esta solicitando el cuarto crédito para compra de mercancía quiere invertir en ropa de invierno o de temporada porque ya se están por llegar las buenas ventas, se dedica ala venta de ropa y artículos usados comenta que solo tiene un hijo aun dependiente de ella y su esposo comenta que se dedica a realizar trabajos de plomería electricidad y también repara lavadoras y que el se encarga de la mayor parte de los gastos familiares, por lo tanto esta pidiendo ayuda de la institución
texts.en: Maria is requesting her 4th loan to buy merchandise to invest in winter and seasonal clothing, because the good season for sales is approaching.  She has a business selling new and second hand clothing.  She mentions that she has only one child who is still dependent upon her and her husband.  Her husband works doing plumbing and electrical work and he also repairs washers.  He has been the one to carry the burden of covering most of the household expenses, which is why she is requesting this help from the institution for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mano Amiga Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras características de cada una de ellas como es el caso de Mariela que tiene una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 3 años, mujer acompañada con tres hijos menores que de los ingresos que le genera su negocio aporta al sustento de su familia, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar, carne de res, carne de pollo etc. Amparo mujer de 68 años vende ropa y Anielka vende ropa y cosechas de frutas.
texts.en: This communal bank has 3 members who are each very enterprising.  Mariela has had a store in her house for 3 years.  She has a partner and 3 children, and with the income she generates from her business she contributes to the support of her family.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of staple foods such as rice and beans, bath soap, laundry soap, beef, chicken, etc.  The other members are Amparo, a 68 year-old woman who sells clothing, and Anielka, who sells clothing and fruit.

loans.use: to buy grains, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Tamazi

texts.en:
Tamazi is 26 years old. He is from a small village in the Bolnisi District. Tamazi has a large family: parents, wife and two infant children. The whole family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have four milk cows and four calves. They are producing cheese and selling locally. In addition, the family rents 9 hectares of agricultural land where wheat is grown. Tamazi also sows potatoes on family-owned land. He cultivates the land with his own mini tractor and significantly saves the costs of cultivation. He sells the harvested potatoes in the local village.

Tamazi requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and cultivate a plot of land. After fertilizing and properly done seasonal work, the family will get a good quality harvest. The harvested products will be sold and the income of the family will be increased. Thus, the living conditions of the family will improve. He is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cultivate a plot of land

loans.name: Ramón Alfredo

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive el señor Ramón, tiene  56 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y el menor tiene 12  años de edad el mismo que estudian en escuela. La mujer se dedica a la casa. 

Él se dedica tanto a la agricultura como a realizar trabajos de soldadura, pues tiene un taller en el cual en temporadas le mandan a realizar obras con el metal, el fabrica puertas, ventanas y otros trabajos en su taller, además también se dedica a sus cultivos y es justo para eso que solicito este crédito pues él tenía sembrado cultivos de arroz, maíz y verduras los mismos que se le perdieron por lo duro del invierno, ahora espera con este crédito volver a sembrar y recuperar lo que se le perdió.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar semillas, fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra de los sembríos. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In a town called Tierras Amarillas, in Rocafuerte canton, the communal bank "Mejorando El Futuro" meets every 15 days.  This area is known for its agriculture, because most of the residents work in short cycle farming.

This is where Ramon lives.  Ramon is 65, and is in a common-law marriage from which he has 2 children.  One of his children is an adult, and the younger one is 12 years old and attends school.  His wife works in the home.

Ramon has 2 occupations: he works as a farmer and does soldering work.  He has a workshop where, in certain seasons, he is sent metalwork projects to complete.   He makes doors, windows and other products in his workshop.  In addition, he works as a farmer, and it is for this work that he is requesting a loan.  He had planted rice, corn and vegetable crops, but he lost them because of the hard winter.  At this time, he is hoping with this loan to replant and recover what he lost.

He will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for farmhands during the planting.  This is his second loan cycle with the communal bank, and he likes it because the loans have helped him a lot.  His dream is to continue to make progress.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for farmhands

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix es nacido en la comunidad de Huaca Wasi de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente es natural de lugar y vive en la comunidad Parra Rancho junto a su esposa y los tres hijos menores a su custodia, actualmente está viviendo en su casa que es una casa rustico que está construido de adobe con techo de calamina y teja con piso y revoque de yeso. El cliente en realidad se dedica a la actividad agrícola cultiva los tubérculos y cereales su comunidad es la parte mas alta del Municipio, al mismo tiempo el crédito que están solicitando es para comprar llantas para su camión, asimismo el cliente está solicitando el tercer crédito cancelando sin dificultad sus cuotas. La comunidad del don Félix se encuentra aproximadamente a 3 km al este de la población de Tiraque hacia al norte camino por canal mayu pasando por millu mayu.
texts.en:
Felix was born in the community of Huaca Wasi in the Tiraque province, in the Cochabamba department. He is currently living in the community of Parra Rancho with his wife and the three youngest children under his custody. He lives in his home, which is a rustic house built of adobe with a corrugated iron roof, tiles in the floor, and gypsum plaster. The client is actually engaged in farming and grows tubers and cereals in his community, in the highest area of the municipality.   

He is applying for a loan to buy tires for his truck. Also, the client is applying for his third loan, he cancelled his installment payments easily. The community of Felix is located approximately 3km east of the town of Tiraque, going north for the channel mayu through millu mayu.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his truck.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, aged 41 years, is a married mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support the family, she has been engaged in farming rice on 2 hectares of farmland and raising pigs. Having been in this business for 30 years, Ly is able to earn about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about 20,000 KHR for future needs. Lack of working capital for buying fertilizer is the main challenge for her paddy field.

Ly has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for three loan cycles, while the other member is new to VisionFund this cycle. Ly successfully paid back the loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on buying pig feeds. Ly hopes to get a high crop yield from her paddy so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran is a 55-year-old married mother who lives with her husband in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one son who is still in school. The main source of family’s income is from rice farming on a 3-hectare area of farmland; she has been in this business for 31 years to make a living. Her daily income is approximately 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, but Ran can manage to save about 10,000 KHR after offsetting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for her paddy-field business.

This is the first microloan for Ran’s group with VisionFund. Her group consists of two members who live in the same village. Ran is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. Ran hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a better living and keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Nelly Narcisa

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos, 6 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y dos de 15 y 13 años, con ellos viven 4 de sus hijos, uno de los mayores estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Nelly trabaja en sociedad con uno de sus hijos, ellos se dedican a la venta de leche y queso, su hijo se desplaza por los campos en un carro que  tienen, compran la leche que venden todas las mañanas ciertos ganaderos para luego llevarla hasta su casa en la cual dedican una parte a elaborar el delicioso queso y la otra parte la llevan  a vender por localidades vecinas junto con el queso que el día anterior fue fabricado, ellos trabajan todos los días en las mañanas y llevan más de 10 años realizando esta labor que si les deja buenos ingresos. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar leche. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del grupo y le  gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.
 
Sus sueños es seguir adelante y que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in the Tierras Amarillas village, located in the canton Rocafuerte, the members of the Communal Bank "Mejorando El Futuro" (Improving the Future) meet. This sector is known for its agriculture, and a large amount of its inhabitants dedicate themselves to the short-cycle crops.

This is where Nelly lives. She is 49 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are already adults and two who are 15 and 13. Four of her children live with her. One of the older ones studies in the university, and the others are still in school. Her husband dedicates himself to agriculture.

Nelly works in society with one of her sons. The dedicate themselves to selling milk and cheese. Her son moves around the fields in a car they have, and they buy milk that certain farmers sell every morning to later bring to their house and make into delicious cheese or sell to neighboring villages along with the cheese they made the day before. They work every day in the morning and have spent 10 years performing this work, which has brings them a good income.

This loan will be used to buy milk. She has been in the Communal Bank from the beginning. She is the treasurer of the group and likes it because her friends are very united and responsible.

Her dream is to keep moving forward and that her young children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron, aged 46 years, resides in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children, four of whom are dependents and still in school. She has earned a living through farming rice on a 2.5-hectare area of farmland for 23 years and supplements her family’s income by selling grocery items. Her family’s income is about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, but Saron can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Lack of working capital is the main challenge in operating her paddy-rice business.

Saron has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles already, while the other member has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. Saron completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. 

Now, she is leading her group of two to request another loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Saron, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: El Sr. Eloy Suárez se dedica ala panadería en la sucursal de walmart desde hace mas de dos años es casado y tiene la edad de 41 años esta solicitando nuestra ayuda ala institución para mejorar su vivienda desea remodelar el cuarto de lavado para una mayor comodidad para el y su familia por tal motivo desea el apoyo de kiva
texts.en:
Eloy Suárez has been working in the bakery of a Walmart store for more than two years. He is 41 years old and married. 

He is applying for help from the institution in order to improve his home. He wishes to renovate the bathroom to provide greater comfort for himself and his family. For this reason he wishes to have Kiva's support.

loans.use: To renovate his bathroom.

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda is a 33-year-old farmer who lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. He is married with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. He is a rice farmer who has been growing rice on 2 hectares of farmland for seven years to support his family. He is able to earn about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. The scarcity of working capital is the main challenge. 

Chanda’s group composes two members who live in the same village, and he is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. He is leading his group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chanda is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. Through this loan, he hopes his crop yield will become more profitable so as to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: First Choice Group

texts.en:
The group First Choice is made up of 13 women all staying in the same neighborhood in South Teshie.  In this town you can see the colorful clothing of African origin worn by the people - elders in particular have kept their traditional dress. The people are hardworking, like these members that work every day in different economic activities such as selling plastic products, fish, meat, provisions, sandals, ladies' wear, bed sheets and spices. 

One of the members of the group is Diana, who has been selling plastic products for twenty-two years. She is 46, married to a 54-year-old civil worker, and has two children ages 24 and 20, both of whom are in school. They don't own a house but stay in the husband's family house.

Diana spends most of her time at her own big store where the plastic products are sold. She sells everything from plastic spoons to plastic chairs - any item made of plastic or rubber. She needs 1000 Ghana cedis to buy more plastic products. She intends to supply to customers and other retailers. This is her fifth loan with microfinance.

She has been investing all her profit so as to buy enough to meet customer demands. Her goal is to have a a plastic products depot since there is none in her locality. 

Together with her colleagues, they will need 5700 Ghana cedis.

loans.use: To buy all types of plastic products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: Azucena de estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hijo pero es mayor de edad. Desde que se separo de su ex pareja ella busco la manera de salir a delante y decidió ponerse un pequeño negocio. Ella comenzó a vender primero focos, cables y poco a poco iba creciendo su negocio hasta formar una ferretería completa. Su único hijo la ayuda con el negocio Pues Azucena trabaja de lunes hasta los sábados de 8:00am hasta las 18:00pm.Su sueño es que su negocio poderlo agrandar mas para luego poder dar trabajo a gente que lo necesite.  Con el préstamo Azucena quiere comprar: cables, toma corriente, focos, arena, piedra, cemento etc.
texts.en: Azucena is single. She has one son, but he is grown. Since she separated from her ex husband, she looked for a way to move forward and decided to start a small business. She started out selling lightbulbs and cables, but little by little, she grew her business until it was a full-fledged hardware store. Her only son helps her with the business. Azucena works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. Her dream for her business is for it to grow more, so that she can then give work to people who need it. With the loan, Azucena wants to buy cables, wall sockets, lightbulbs, sand, stone, cement, etc.

loans.use: to buy cables, wall sockets, light bulbs, sand, stone, cement, etc.

loans.name: Estrella Del Consuelo

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, la menor de ellos vive en su casa. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días  desde las 07h00 hasta las  a las 19h00 ya que prepara desayunos, almuerzo, meriendas y platos a la carta, su especialidad son los mariscos ya que es el plato preferido de sus clientes, tiene restaurante por más de 25  años y gracias a este negocio ella pudo ayudar a su marido a  sacar adelante a sus hijos y su familia, ella prepara también deliciosas salchichas las cuales son muy apetecidas por sus  clientes.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de año y medio  y le gusta porque siempre la han sacado de apuros. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su esposo venda sus productos ya que anda en un triciclo.
texts.en:
The members of the "Mejorando el Futuro" communal bank meet every two weeks in the town of Tierras Amarillas in Rocafuerte canton. This area is known for its farming, as a great part of its population work in short-cycle agriculture. 

This is where Estrella lives. She is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children, all adults. The youngest of them lives in her home. Her husband is a merchant. 

She has a small restaurant in her home where she prepares delicious dishes. She works every day from 7:00am to 7:00pm as she makes breakfast, lunch, snacks and à la carte dishes. Her specialty is seafood, as it is her customers' favorite dish.  

She has had a restaurant for more than 25 years, and thanks to this business has been able to help her husband raise their family. She also prepares delicious sausages which are very sought after by her customers.

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies for preparing food. She has been in the communal bank for more than a year and a half, and likes it because they have always helped her overcome difficulties. 

Her dream is to buy a car, so that her husband can sell his products, as now he goes around on a tricycle.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Dúo Redentor En Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo Redentor en Dios, Doña Normas es originaria de San Andres Itzapa es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora todos los dias desde muy temprano se levanta a vender su producto que es leche, y tiene que madrugar para aprovechar la mañana, ya que despues de esta actividad se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de maiz para la elaboracion de tortillas ya que para generar mas ganancias necesita invertir más
texts.en:
Redentor en Dios Duo

Norma's a native of San Andrés Itzapa.  She's a very hardworking person who strives every day.  She gets up very early to sell her product, which is milk.  She has to get up early to make the most of the morning because after this she works making and selling tortillas.

She's requesting this loan to buy corn to make tortillas because to get more profits she needs to invest more.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Due to insufficient income, Lovely engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 25 years old, and they have two infant-age children. They are raising their family in a rural community, planting fruits and vegetables and raising livestock for sale. They aim to earn and save more income to satisfy their necessities and save for the future of their children. 

They planned to plant more vegetables and raise more pigs to sell, but they do not have enough capital. Therefore, Lovely is asking for an additional 35,000 Philippines pesos to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that through patience and hard work, they will improve their business and status of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Lorena Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Lorena tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera. Se dedica al comercio de pupusas en los buses desde hace 8 años. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar la venta; fue su madre quien le enseño ese negocio. De esa forma Lorena ha podido brindarles lo necesario a sus dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Los materiales que necesita como el maíz, los compra por quintales. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 sacos de maíz, carne y quesillo para elaborar las pupusas. Esto le servirá para incrementar sus ventas y por supuesto sus ingresos para apoyar económicamente a su familia. Ella desea disponer de más vendedores para cubrir las rutas de autobuses.
texts.en:
Lorena, 36, is single.  She has made a living selling "pupusas" [stuffed tortillas] on buses for eight years.  It was her husband who taught her this business.  She gets up very early to get ready.  This way Lorena has been able to give her two children, who are adults, the necessities.  She buys the materials she needs, such as corn, by the quintal.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy four sacks of corn, meat, and soft cheese to make the pupusas.

This will help her increase her sales and, of course, her income to financially support her family.  She wants to have more vendors to cover the bus routes.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, and cheese for pupusas

loans.name: Eduardo Placido

texts.es: Eduardo de estado civil casado, tiene hijos. Eduardo comento que su vida diaria a sido de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación por que le quiere un mejor bienestar a sus familia .Eduardo comenta que trato de buscar un trabajo estable pero nadie le abrió las puertas de una empresa,  por eso si inicio en el trabajo que desempeñaba su padre la de maestro constructor o albañil. Por lo que ahora ese es su trabajo y realiza cuando alguien lo contrato por lo general trabaja de 8:00am hasta 18:00pm , y Eduardo contrata a 2 ayudantes para trabajar con El : Con el préstamo él quiere comprar herramientas, y arreglar su vivienda
texts.en: Eduardo is in a civil marriage and has children. He commented that his daily life has been one of much effort and dedication because he wants a better life for his family. He says that he tried looking for a stable job, but no company opened their doors to him. This is why he started working as his father did, as a master builder or bricklayer. That is his job now and when someone hires him, he usually works from 8:00am until 18:00pm. Eduardo hires two helpers to work with him. With the loan, he wants to buy tools and fix his home.

loans.use: to buy tools and fix his house

loans.name: Bak's Group

texts.en:
Bak, 36, is married with two children and resides in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Both of her children are dependent on her; one is in school, while the other works for others for a fee to earn additional income for the family. To support the family, Bak and her husband have been catching fish for twelve years and sometimes they work as paid workers in the local area to gain more income to better support the family. Her family's income is about KHR 35,000 per day and they can save about KHR 5,000 each day for their future needs. 

Bak’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Bak completely paid back the previous loans with VisionFund and successfully used the loans to renovate her old house. She and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 500,000 and KHR 1,000,000 respectively. Bak will use her portion to buy fishing materials to support her fishing business. Bak hopes this loan will help her to earn more income so as to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to support her fishing business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 51 years old, married, and has five grown-up children. They live happily in a rural community where they are able to grow plants and raise livestock for sale. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living so that they can educate their children and give them bright futures. They help each other in cultivating their farm to generate income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Betty decided to raise more pigs for sale. Due to inadequate capital, Betty is asking for an additional P35,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and piglets to raise. She believes that this financial assistance will allow her to make an improvement in her business. She is hoping that someday, she will become financially stable by continuing to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Kleber Joel

texts.es: Kleber vive en Quevedo  de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos de 13 años son gemelos y estudian en una colegio público del sector. A  Kleber le enseñaron la profesión de panadero desde que era muy pequeño  a los 10 años el ya elaboraba pan en la panadería de su cuñado por eso toda su vida sea  dedicado a eso ahora que es mayor de edad el tiene su propia panadería. Su sueño es comprarse una casa y que su negocio crezca aun más porque él trabaja solo de 7:00 am hasta 15:00pm de lunes a domingo .Una de sus dificultades es que le falta herramienta y como él trabaja solo es muy cansado para el por eso , Con el préstamo Kleber quiere comprar harina, manteca , mantequilla, moldes etc.
texts.en:
Kleber lives in Quevedo in a civil marriage. He has two 13-year-old sons. They are twins and they study in a public school in the area. Kleber was taught the profession of baking when he was very young. At age 10 he was already making bread in his brother-in-law’s bakery. This is why his whole life is dedicated to that. 

Now that he is an adult, he has his own bakery. His dream is to buy a house and that his business grows even more because he works alone from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. from Monday to Sunday. One of his difficulties is that he is missing tools, and since he works alone it is very tiring. This is why with the loan Kleber wants to buy flour, shortening, butter, baking pans, etc.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, butter, baking pans, etc.

loans.name: Yary's Group

texts.en:
Yary is aged 24 years and married with two dependent children, both of whom are still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, earning a living by working as a tailor in a local area while her husband works as a paid construction worker to help earn income to support the family. Having been in business for twenty years, they can earn about KHR25,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for their future needs.

This is Yary’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Yary, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy a sewing machine to help her tailoring business. She hopes to improve her current business so as to better her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to help her tailoring business

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak is 36 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Preahnet Preach district of Banteay Meanchey Province. She has two dependent children to take care of. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for six years. To add up more income, her husband also raises pigs. With the current business, Seak can earn approximately 30,000KHR per day and save about 20,000KHR each day for their future needs. Low crop yields is the main challenge.  

This is the first micro-loan for Seak’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Seak will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pig feed for her pig business. She hopes to increase her current businesses so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland, and pig feed for her pig business

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres microempresarias de éxito que se dedica una de ellas  Silvia vende tamal, pinol, pinolillo ambulante desde hace 24 años  herencia de sus padres , tiene 10 años de estar en la institución y el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de maíz, cacao, canela, especies etc. El caso de Teresa vende y hace cosa de horno hecho de maíz y Liliam vende verduras.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three successful women entrepreneurs. Silvia is one of them. She has been selling tamales, toasted maize flour, and maize flour drinks for twenty-four years. She learned the trade from her parents. She has been working with the field partner for ten years. She will use the loan to buy maize, cocoa, cinnamon, spices, etc. A few words about the other members: Teresa bakes and sells various maize-based products while Liliam sells vegetables.

loans.use: to buy maize, cocoa, cinnamon, spices, etc.

loans.name: Pek's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Pek is a 55-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her and work at a garment factory to help the family generate income. She has earned a living through farming rice and planting oranges for thirteen years. To better support the family, her husband also raises cows and works as a paid worker in the local area. The current business earns her family about 60,000KHR per day, but Pek can manage to save about 30,000KHR each day for their future needs after deducting daily expenses.
 
Pek has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which constantly supported her family with enough food and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation business and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. With this loan, Pek hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation business

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Señor Félix tiene 51 años de edad vive en Chimoré del departamento de Cochabamba es agricultor pero también tiene otro ingreso de portero de una institución que adopto por vivir por la zona donde esta establecida esta zona. Félix es una persona sencilla humilde y estuvo acostumbrado a la labor del campo, como agricultor le fue siempre bien y al pasar el tiempo siendo el una persona muy confiada fue arrebatada de sus pertenencias y patrimonio por su propia pareja quien se fue y hasta ahora no da rastros de su paradero, Félix se quedo con un hijo a quien le mantiene y educa como padre y madre después de haber vencido la decepción del abandono que sufrió se repuso y trabajo muy duro para tener lo que tiene ahora, al enterarse de los créditos Kiva él solicita una ayuda para poder comprar una motocicleta para hacerla trabajar en el transporte publico con lo que podrá contar con otros ingresos mas y así poder dar mejores momentos a su hijo y a el mismo.
texts.en: Félix is fifty-one and lives in Chimoré, in the region of Cochabamba. He is a farmer, but also works as a caretaker in an institution that is close by to where he lives. Félix is a simple and humble person, used to farm work. He was doing well as a farmer. However, his spouse took advantage of his honesty and left with his belongings and his money, never to be seen again. Félix was left to take care of and raise his son all by himself. In spite of the anguish caused by the betrayal he suffered, he managed to throw himself into his work in order to own what he now owns. He learned of the existence of Kiva loans and asks for help in order to buy a motorcycle that would enable him to provide taxi services. This would increase his income and thus improve the quality of life of both his son and himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moungkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Saly is a 57-year-old widowed mother of seven children, two of whom (one daughter and one son) are dependents and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source for her family’s income for thirty years. To add to the income, Saly also works as a tailor in the local area. The current businesses earn her approximately 30,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The main challenge for her family’s business are the low crop yields resulting from flooding.

Saly’s group consists of five members who live in the same village and she is in her sixth cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Saly, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy fabrics for her tailoring business. Saly hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and buy fabric for her tailoring business

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural area of Thmor Koul district located in Battambang province of Cambodia, Sina is 31 years of age. She is married and has two dependent children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are currently in school. To support her family, Sina has a small business selling grocery items whilst her husband complements the income by working as a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland. 

This hardworking woman, Sina, has been operating her business (selling grocery items) for eight years. She is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The first loan that she requested has enabled her to secure the food needs for her family and, most importantly, be able to educate her beloved children by sending them to a good school. Now she is in need of money to support her husband’s rice-growing business by purchasing fertilizer to apply to the rice field. Therefore, she is leading a group member named Phally, who is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR each. Via the help of this loan, Sina strongly believes that the business of her husband will go smoothly and she will be able to expand her grocery-selling business so that the family’s income will increase gradually.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Shamman's Group

texts.en:
Shamman is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children. She couldn’t help her children complete their educations due to financial constraints. Now her elder son works while remaining at home.

Shamman is a housewife; she performs her household duties very well by staying at home. Her husband sells flowers. He makes beautiful flower bouquets, which sell for good prices.

Shamman has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy flowers in larger quantities, which will help him make more profits from his business.

loans.use: to buy flowers for her husband's flowers-selling business

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria de estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos Hace 10 años aprendió peluquería, maquillaje lo que hizo su profesión. En la actualidad tiene muchos clientes desde hombres, mujeres y niños que prefieren su atención porque la conocen desde hace mucho tiempo. Gloria nos comenta que hace 3 años atrás también empezó a vender productos de belleza por el sector laborando de lunes a viernes desde las 9 hasta las 5 de la tarde. En su gabinete ofrece cortes con estilo, permanentes, alisados, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas y demás. Le gusta lo que realiza ya que permite cuidar de sus hijos quienes están en la etapa escolar y asisten a la escuela fiscal de Duran . Con el préstamo que está solicitando comprara tintes, ampollas para el cabello, esmaltes y herramientas para el gabinete. Espera mejorar sus ingresos para arreglar un poco el local.
texts.en: Gloria is single and has two children. 10 years ago, she learned how to do hair and make-up, which made up her profession. She currently has many clients including men, women and children that prefer her services because they have known her for so long. Gloria tells us that 3 years ago, she also started selling beauty products working Monday to Friday from 9 until 5 in the afternoon. From her workstation, she offers cuts with styles, perms, nails and more. She likes that her job allows her to take care of her children who are school age and attend the public school of Duran. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy dyes, hair treatments, fingernail enamels and tools for her station. Gloria hopes to improve her income and fix up her shop a little.

loans.use: to buy dyes, hair treatments, fingernail enamels, and tools for her workstation.

loans.name: José Ovidio

texts.es:
José tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo.  A la edad de 18 años, él empezó a trabajar en una empresa de maquila, trabajando durante un año en el área de sastre, a los 20 años se traslado de domicilio, instalando allí su propia sastrería en donde confecciona; pantalones, faldas, blusas, uniformes, entre otras prendas más. Su esposa esta cursando su ultimo año en la universidad de profesorado en matemáticas. Él y su hija se sienten muy felices, por que el sueño de su familia se va hacer realidad, es una familia unida tienen buena reputación en la comunidad, con valores y principios.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de su casa de bloque. Él posee unos ahorros y con el préstamo piensa completar el presupuesto que necesita para construir la casa. De esta forma, él lograra otro objetivo, al brindar a su familia mayor seguridad y comodidad, además piensa adquirir otro terreno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old, married, and has a child. At age 18, he began to work in a textile factory, working for a year as a tailor. At 20 years old, he moved homes, setting up his own tailor’s shop there in which he makes pants, skirts, blouses, uniforms, among other garments. His wife is studying in her last year at the university to teach mathematics. He and his daughter are very happy because the dream of their family is going to become a reality. It is a close family. They have a good reputation in the community, with values and principles.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to pay the labor for the construction of his cinder block house. He has some savings and with the loan he intends to complete the budget that he needs to construct the house. With this he will achieve another objective: to provide better security and comfort to his family. Furthermore, he plans to acquire another plot of land for his children.

loans.use: to pay the labor for the construction of his cinder block house.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is a father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 28 years old and has three infant-aged children. He aims to uplift his family's status of living to provide for his family's needs and give them a better life. Aside from farming, he also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He planned to raise more piglets to sell but he does not have enough capital. In this regard, he is requesting an additional P35,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. Despite problems and difficulties he encountered in life, he believes that he can improve the business and make it more profitable. He is hoping that someday, he will become successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a 55-years-old married woman and mother of two. She has been successfully running a general store for the past twelve months. She offers various items of daily use at reasonable prices. She is required to support her family financially as her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed. One of her sons works as a conductor for a local bus but his income is unpredictable and insufficient to support the needs of the family members, while Razia’s income is enough to bear everyday expenditures. In order to purchase stock of sugar and packs of oil, spices, and rice, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000. In this way she would be able to cater to the demands of her customers consistently, which would help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar and packs of oil, spices, and rice for her general store

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Faustina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa en el comercio de artesanías, principalmente de elementos tejidos como chompas, bufandas, guantes y chullos pero también con artículos de joyería en plata como collares, pulseras, anillos etc. y los comercializa en la feria turística del pueblo en la plaza de l pueblo. Faustina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para capitalizar su actividad.
Faustina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
This is Faustina. She belongs to the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” in the district of Andahuaylillas in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco, Peru. She continues with the sale of traditional crafts, mainly knitted items like sweaters, scarves, gloves, and wool hats, but also articles of silver jewelry such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc. She sells them in a tourist market in the town in the town square. Faustina this time requires the loan to buy merchandise to capitalize her business.

Faustina is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to continue in her economic activity and with this work bring sustenance home.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, scarves, gloves, wool hats, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Como una buena madre  joven e impulsadora Gloria de 25 años comparte una vida de pareja con Tito, ambos con el pequeño Benjamin para el cual ya lograron construir una casa de material noble con esfuerzo y dedicación donde comparten una linda vida de familia. La actividad mas impulsada y productiva de la zona es también desempeñada por ella y su pareja, quienes desde hace 5 años obtienen cacao de calidad y bien cotizado por los acopiadores. De esta forma extraen el máximo provecho a sus parcelas adquiridas con el apoyo de sus padres buscando generar más capital de trabajo con el cual anhelan adquirir mas parcelas para la producción de otros productos. Dentro de las actividades cuyo esfuerzo considera debe ser mayor es el sembrado de almácigos e injertos de cacao cuya actividad termina por agotarla pero con una satisfacción de haber terminado bien su trabajo. Tito quien también desempeña su trabajo de codo a codo apoya en actividades pesadas como el traslado de los granos secos hasta las vías de acceso para transportarlos a la ciudad para su posterior venta junto a otros jornaleros. Para lograr una producción de calidad es necesario trabajar desde el comienzo posterior a la época de cosecha según  comenta, por el cual en experiencia a su buen desempeño en el campo es necesario adquirir en lo pronto más almácigos e injertos así como abonos orgánicos.
Cuando las cosas salen bien más que la ganancia económica es la recompensa de saber que con esfuerzo y dedicación todo es posible según indica y planea seguir laborando en el rubro, puesto que su sueño es de lograr personalmente exportar sus productos. Lleva hasta el momento 03 préstamos para el cual promete trabajar con mas esmero, se siente contenta por la manera en como se desempeñan sus compañeros de su banco comunal esperando seguir incluso mucho mas tiempo con ellos y con MFP.
Con los 2,000 soles realizará la compra de más almácigos de cacao así como abono orgánico y la contrata de jornaleros para iniciar la época de sembrio y mantenimiento del mismo.
texts.en:
Like a good and driven young mother, Gloria, 25, shares life with her partner Tito and little Benjamin, for whom they already managed to build a house of good materials, with effort and dedication, where they share a beautiful family life.

She and her partner work at what is also the most common and productive work in the region.  For five years they have acquired quality, desirable cacao from the distributors.
